sentences.zh: 秦之先，帝顓頊之苗裔孫曰女修。

translations.literal: Qin ancestors, Emperor Zhuan Xu descendants grandson called Nu Xiu.
translations.idiomatic: The ancestors of Qin were descendants of Emperor Zhuan Xu, and there was a grandson named Nu Xiu.

sentences.zh: 女修織，玄鳥隕卵，女修吞之，生子大業。

translations.literal: Nu Xiu weaving, dark bird fell egg, Nu Xiu swallowed it, gave birth son Da Ye.
translations.idiomatic: Nu Xiu was weaving when a dark bird dropped an egg. Nu Xiu swallowed it and gave birth to a son named Da Ye.

sentences.zh: 大業取少典之子，曰女華。

translations.literal: Da Ye took Shao Dian son, called Nu Hua.
translations.idiomatic: Da Ye took a daughter of Shao Dian as his wife, named Nu Hua.

sentences.zh: 女華生大費，與禹平水土。

translations.literal: Nu Hua gave birth Da Fei, with Yu pacified water earth.
translations.idiomatic: Nu Hua gave birth to Da Fei, who helped Yu pacify the waters and lands.

sentences.zh: 已成，帝錫玄圭。

translations.literal: Already completed, emperor bestowed dark jade tablet.
translations.idiomatic: When it was completed, the emperor bestowed a dark jade tablet.

sentences.zh: 禹受曰：「非予能成，亦大費為輔。」

translations.literal: Yu received said: 'Not I could complete, also Da Fei as assistant.'
translations.idiomatic: Yu received it and said, 'It was not I who could complete this; Da Fei also served as my assistant.'

sentences.zh: 帝舜曰：「咨爾費，贊禹功，其賜爾皁游。

translations.literal: Emperor Shun said: 'Alas you Fei, aided Yu merit, will grant you dark flag.
translations.idiomatic: Emperor Shun said, 'Ah, you Fei, who aided Yu's merit—I will grant you a dark banner.

sentences.zh: 爾後嗣將大出。」

translations.literal: You descendants will greatly emerge.'
translations.idiomatic: Your descendants will greatly flourish.'

sentences.zh: 乃妻之姚姓之玉女。

translations.literal: Then married him Yao surname jade girl.
translations.idiomatic: So he was married to a jade girl of the Yao surname.

sentences.zh: 大費拜受，佐舜調馴鳥獸，鳥獸多馴服，是為柏翳。

translations.literal: Da Fei bowed accepted, assisted Shun tamed birds beasts, birds beasts many tamed, this was Bai Yi.
translations.idiomatic: Da Fei bowed and accepted it. He assisted Shun in taming birds and beasts, and many birds and beasts were tamed. This is why he was called Bai Yi.

sentences.zh: 舜賜姓嬴氏。

translations.literal: Shun granted surname Ying clan.
translations.idiomatic: Shun granted him the surname Ying.

translations.literal: Qin's ancestors were the descendants of Emperor Zhuanxu. His grandson was called Nüxiu. Nüxiu was weaving when a dark bird dropped an egg. Nüxiu swallowed it and gave birth to a son named Daye. Daye took Shao Dian's daughter, named Nü Hua. Nü Hua gave birth to Da Fei, who helped Yu pacify the waters and lands. When it was completed, the emperor bestowed a dark jade tablet. Yu accepted it and said: 'I could not have completed it alone. Da Fei was my assistant.' Emperor Shun said: 'Ah, you Fei, you aided Yu's merit. I will grant you the dark banner. Your descendants will greatly emerge.' Then he married him to a jade girl of the Yao surname. Da Fei bowed and accepted. He assisted Shun in taming birds and beasts. Many birds and beasts were tamed. He was called Bai Yi. Shun granted him the surname Ying.

sentences.zh: 大費生子二人：一曰大廉，實鳥俗氏；

translations.literal: Da Fei gave birth two sons: one called Da Lian, established Niao Su clan;
translations.idiomatic: Da Fei had two sons: one named Da Lian, who established the Niao Su clan;

sentences.zh: 二曰若木，實費氏。

translations.literal: two called Ruo Mu, established Fei clan.
translations.idiomatic: the second named Ruo Mu, who established the Fei clan.

sentences.zh: 其玄孫曰費昌，子孫或在中國，或在夷狄。

translations.literal: His great-grandson called Fei Chang, descendants some in central states, some among barbarians.
translations.idiomatic: His great-grandson was named Fei Chang. His descendants were sometimes in the central states, sometimes among the barbarians.

sentences.zh: 費昌當夏桀之時，去夏歸商，為湯御，以敗桀於鳴條。

translations.literal: Fei Chang during Xia Jie time, left Xia joined Shang, drove for Tang, to defeat Jie at Ming Tiao.
translations.idiomatic: During the time of Xia Jie, Fei Chang left Xia and joined Shang. He drove the chariot for Tang and helped defeat Jie at Ming Tiao.

sentences.zh: 大廉玄孫曰孟戲、中衍，鳥身人言。

translations.literal: Da Lian great-grandson called Meng Xi, Zhong Yan, bird body human speech.
translations.idiomatic: Da Lian's great-grandsons were named Meng Xi and Zhong Yan. They had bird bodies but spoke like humans.

sentences.zh: 帝太戊聞而卜之使御，吉，遂致使御而妻之。

translations.literal: Emperor Tai Wu heard and divined it made drive, auspicious, then caused made drive and married him.
translations.idiomatic: Emperor Tai Wu heard of this and divined whether to have him drive the chariot. It was auspicious, so he had him drive and then married him to a woman.

sentences.zh: 自太戊以下，中衍之後，遂世有功，以佐殷國，故嬴姓多顯，遂為諸侯。

translations.literal: From Tai Wu below, Zhong Yan descendants, then generations had merit, to assist Yin state, therefore Ying surname many illustrious, then became feudal lords.
translations.idiomatic: From Tai Wu downward, Zhong Yan's descendants generation after generation had merit and assisted the Yin state. Therefore, those of the Ying surname became numerous and illustrious, and eventually became feudal lords.

translations.literal: Da Fei had two sons: one named Da Lian, who established the Niaosu clan; the second named Ruomu, who established the Fei clan. His great-grandson was named Fei Chang. His descendants were sometimes in the central states, sometimes among the barbarians. Fei Chang, during Xia Jie's time, left Xia and joined Shang. He drove for Tang and helped defeat Jie at Mingtao. Da Lian's great-grandson was named Meng Xi and Zhong Yan. They had bird bodies but human speech. Emperor Tai Wu heard of it and divined to have them drive. It was auspicious. He then had them drive and married them to him. From Tai Wu onward, Zhong Yan's descendants generation after generation had merit and assisted the Yin state. Therefore the Ying surname had many illustrious members and became feudal lords.

sentences.zh: 其玄孫曰中潏，在西戎，保西垂。

translations.literal: His great-grandson called Zhong Hao, in western Rong, guarded western frontier.
translations.idiomatic: His great-grandson was named Zhong Hao. He was among the western Rong and guarded the western frontier.

sentences.zh: 生蜚廉。

translations.literal: Gave birth Fei Lian.
translations.idiomatic: He gave birth to Fei Lian.

sentences.zh: 蜚廉生惡來。

translations.literal: Fei Lian gave birth E Lai.
translations.idiomatic: Fei Lian gave birth to E Lai.

sentences.zh: 惡來有力，蜚廉善走，父子俱以材力事殷紂。

translations.literal: E Lai had strength, Fei Lian good at running, father son both with abilities served Yin Zhou.
translations.idiomatic: E Lai was strong, Fei Lian was good at running. Father and son both served Yin Zhou with their abilities and strength.

sentences.zh: 周武王之伐紂，并殺惡來。

translations.literal: Zhou Wu Wang attacked Zhou, also killed E Lai.
translations.idiomatic: When King Wu of Zhou attacked Zhou, he also killed E Lai.

sentences.zh: 是時蜚廉為紂石北方，還，無所報，為壇霍太山而報，得石棺，銘曰「帝令處父不與殷亂，賜爾石棺以華氏」。

translations.literal: This time Fei Lian for Zhou surveyed north, returned, nothing to report, made altar Huo Mount Tai and reported, got stone coffin, inscription said 'Heaven commanded Chu Fu not participate Yin chaos, granted you stone coffin to glorify clan.'
translations.idiomatic: At this time, Fei Lian surveyed the north for Zhou. He returned with nothing to report, so he made an altar at Huo Mount Tai to make his report. He received a stone coffin with an inscription that said, 'Heaven commanded Chu Fu not to participate in Yin's chaos. I grant you this stone coffin to glorify your clan.'

sentences.zh: 死，遂葬於霍太山。

translations.literal: Died, then buried at Huo Mount Tai.
translations.idiomatic: He died and was buried at Huo Mount Tai.

sentences.zh: 蜚廉復有子曰季勝。

translations.literal: Fei Lian again had son called Ji Sheng.
translations.idiomatic: Fei Lian had another son named Ji Sheng.

sentences.zh: 季勝生孟增。

translations.literal: Ji Sheng gave birth Meng Zeng.
translations.idiomatic: Ji Sheng gave birth to Meng Zeng.

sentences.zh: 孟增幸於周成王，是為宅皋狼。

translations.literal: Meng Zeng favored by Zhou Cheng Wang, this was Zhai Gao Lang.
translations.idiomatic: Meng Zeng was favored by King Cheng of Zhou. This is why he was called Zhai Gao Lang.

sentences.zh: 皋狼生衡父，衡父生造父。

translations.literal: Gao Lang gave birth Heng Fu, Heng Fu gave birth Zao Fu.
translations.idiomatic: Gao Lang gave birth to Heng Fu, and Heng Fu gave birth to Zao Fu.

sentences.zh: 造父以善御幸於周繆王，得驥、溫驪、驊騮、騄耳之駟，西巡狩，樂而忘歸。

translations.literal: Zao Fu with good driving favored by Zhou Mu Wang, got Ji, Wen Li, Hua Liu, Luo Er team, west inspected, pleased and forgot return.
translations.idiomatic: Zao Fu was favored by King Mu of Zhou for his skill at driving. He received a team of horses including Ji, Wen Li, Hua Liu, and Luo Er. They went on a western inspection tour, and the king was so pleased he forgot to return.

sentences.zh: 徐偃王作亂，造父為繆王御，長驅歸周，一日千里以救亂。

translations.literal: Xu Yan Wang made rebellion, Zao Fu drove for Mu Wang, long drove returned Zhou, one day thousand li to save chaos.
translations.idiomatic: When King Yan of Xu rebelled, Zao Fu drove the chariot for King Mu. He drove a long distance back to Zhou, covering a thousand li in one day to save the realm from chaos.

sentences.zh: 繆王以趙城封造父，造父族由此為趙氏。

translations.literal: Mu Wang with Zhao city enfeoffed Zao Fu, Zao Fu clan from this became Zhao clan.
translations.idiomatic: King Mu enfeoffed Zao Fu with Zhao city. From this, Zao Fu's clan became the Zhao clan.

sentences.zh: 自蜚廉生季勝已下五世至造父，別居趙。

translations.literal: From Fei Lian gave birth Ji Sheng below five generations to Zao Fu, separately resided Zhao.
translations.idiomatic: From Fei Lian's son Ji Sheng downward, five generations to Zao Fu, they resided separately in Zhao.

sentences.zh: 趙衰其後也。

translations.literal: Zhao Shuai his descendant.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao Shuai was one of their descendants.

sentences.zh: 惡來革者，蜚廉子也，蚤死。

translations.literal: E Lai Ge, Fei Lian son also, early died.
translations.idiomatic: E Lai Ge was also a son of Fei Lian, but he died early.

sentences.zh: 有子曰女防。

translations.literal: Had son called Nü Fang.
translations.idiomatic: He had a son named Nü Fang.

sentences.zh: 女防生旁皋，旁皋生太幾，太幾生大駱，大駱生非子。

translations.literal: Nü Fang gave birth Pang Gao, Pang Gao gave birth Tai Ji, Tai Ji gave birth Da Luo, Da Luo gave birth Fei Zi.
translations.idiomatic: Nü Fang gave birth to Pang Gao, Pang Gao gave birth to Tai Ji, Tai Ji gave birth to Da Luo, and Da Luo gave birth to Fei Zi.

sentences.zh: 以造父之寵，皆蒙趙城，姓趙氏。

translations.literal: With Zao Fu favor, all received Zhao city, surname Zhao clan.
translations.idiomatic: Because of Zao Fu's favor, they all received portions of Zhao city and took the surname Zhao.

translations.literal: His great-grandson was named Zhong Hao. He was among the western Rong and guarded the western frontier. He gave birth to Fei Lian. Fei Lian gave birth to E Lai. E Lai was strong, Fei Lian was good at running. Father and son both served King Zhou of Yin with their abilities. When King Wu of Zhou attacked King Zhou, he also killed E Lai. At this time, Fei Lian surveyed the north for King Zhou. He returned with nothing to report. He made an altar at Mount Huo Tai and prayed for guidance. He got a stone coffin with the inscription: 'Heaven commanded Chu Fu not to participate in Yin's chaos. It grants you this stone coffin to glorify your clan.' He died and was buried at Mount Huo Tai. Fei Lian had another son named Ji Sheng. Ji Sheng gave birth to Meng Zeng. Meng Zeng was favored by King Cheng of Zhou. He was called Zhai Gao Lang. Gao Lang gave birth to Heng Fu. Heng Fu gave birth to Zao Fu. Zao Fu, with his good driving, was favored by King Mu of Zhou. He got the team of Ji, Wenli, Hualiu, and Luoe. They went west on inspection, became so pleased they forgot to return. King Yan of Xu made rebellion. Zao Fu drove for King Mu, rushing back to Zhou, covering a thousand li in one day to save the situation. King Mu enfeoffed Zao Fu with Zhao city. Zao Fu's clan from this became the Zhao clan. From Fei Lian's birth of Ji Sheng, five generations down to Zao Fu, they separately resided in Zhao. Zhao Shuai was his descendant. E Lai Ge was also Fei Lian's son. He died early. He had a son named Nü Fang. Nü Fang gave birth to Pang Gao. Pang Gao gave birth to Tai Ji. Tai Ji gave birth to Da Luo. Da Luo gave birth to Fei Zi. With Zao Fu's favor, they all received Zhao city and took the surname Zhao.

sentences.zh: 非子居犬丘，好馬及畜，善養息之。

translations.literal: Fei Zi resided Quan Qiu, liked horses and livestock, good at raising multiplying them.
translations.idiomatic: Fei Zi resided at Quan Qiu. He loved horses and livestock and was skilled at raising and breeding them.

sentences.zh: 犬丘人言之周孝王，孝王召使主馬于汧渭之閒，馬大蕃息。

translations.literal: Quan Qiu people spoke of it to Zhou Xiao Wang, Xiao Wang summoned made him manage horses between Qian Wei, horses greatly multiplied.
translations.idiomatic: The people of Quan Qiu spoke of this to King Xiao of Zhou. King Xiao summoned him and had him manage the horses between the Qian and Wei rivers, where the horses greatly multiplied.

sentences.zh: 孝王欲以為大駱適嗣。

translations.literal: Xiao Wang wished to make him Da Luo proper heir.
translations.idiomatic: King Xiao wished to make him Da Luo's proper heir.

sentences.zh: 申侯之女為大駱妻，生子成為適。

translations.literal: Shen Hou daughter became Da Luo wife, gave birth son Cheng as proper.
translations.idiomatic: But Lord Shen's daughter was Da Luo's wife and gave birth to a son named Cheng, who became the proper heir.

sentences.zh: 申侯乃言孝王曰：「昔我先酈山之女，為戎胥軒妻，生中潏，以親故歸周，保西垂，西垂以其故和睦。

translations.literal: Shen Hou then spoke Xiao Wang said: 'Formerly my ancestor Li Shan daughter, became Rong Xu Xuan wife, gave birth Zhong Hao, because kinship returned Zhou, guarded western frontier, western frontier with its reason harmonious.
translations.idiomatic: Lord Shen then spoke to King Xiao, saying, 'Formerly, a daughter of my ancestor Li Shan became the wife of Rong Xu Xuan and gave birth to Zhong Hao. Because of kinship ties, he returned to Zhou and guarded the western frontier. The western frontier was harmonious because of this.'

sentences.zh: 今我復與大駱妻，生適子成。

translations.literal: Now I again give to Da Luo wife, give birth proper son Cheng.
translations.idiomatic: Now I have again given my daughter in marriage to Da Luo, and she has given birth to the proper son Cheng.'

sentences.zh: 申駱重婚，西戎皆服，所以為王。

translations.literal: Shen Luo double marriage, western Rong all submit, therefore serve king.
translations.idiomatic: Through the double marriage alliance between Shen and Luo, all the western Rong submit. This is why you serve as king.'

sentences.zh: 王其圖之。」

translations.literal: King should consider it.'
translations.idiomatic: Your Majesty should consider this.'

sentences.zh: 於是孝王曰：「昔伯翳為舜主畜，畜多息，故有土，賜姓嬴。

translations.literal: Thus Xiao Wang said: 'Formerly Bo Yi for Shun managed livestock, livestock greatly multiplied, therefore had land, granted surname Ying.
translations.idiomatic: So King Xiao said, 'Formerly, Bo Yi managed livestock for Shun. The livestock greatly multiplied, so he was given land and granted the surname Ying.'

sentences.zh: 今其後世亦為朕息馬，朕其分土為附庸。」

translations.literal: Now their descendants also for me multiply horses, I will divide land as fief.'
translations.idiomatic: Now their descendants also multiply horses for me. I will divide land for them as a fief.'

sentences.zh: 邑之秦，使復續嬴氏祀，號曰秦嬴。

translations.literal: Enfeoffed him Qin, made continue Ying clan sacrifices, titled Qin Ying.
translations.idiomatic: He enfeoffed him at Qin, had him continue the Ying clan sacrifices, and titled him Qin Ying.

sentences.zh: 亦不廢申侯之女子為駱適者，以和西戎。

translations.literal: Also not discard Shen Hou daughter as Luo proper, to harmonize western Rong.
translations.idiomatic: He also did not discard Lord Shen's daughter as Da Luo's proper wife, in order to maintain harmony with the western Rong.

translations.literal: Fei Zi resided at Quanqiu. He liked horses and livestock, and was good at raising and multiplying them. The people of Quanqiu spoke of it to King Xiao of Zhou. King Xiao summoned him to manage the horses between the Qian and Wei rivers. The horses greatly multiplied. King Xiao wished to make him Da Luo's proper heir. Shen Hou's daughter became Da Luo's wife and gave birth to a son named Cheng as the proper heir. Shen Hou then spoke to King Xiao and said: 'Formerly my ancestor's Li Shan daughter became the wife of Rong Xuxuan and gave birth to Zhong Hao. Because of kinship, he returned to Zhou and guarded the western frontier. The western frontier was harmonious because of this. Now I again give my daughter to Da Luo as wife, and she gives birth to the proper son Cheng. With the double marriage between Shen and Luo, the western Rong all submit. This is why we serve the king. Your majesty should consider this.' Thus King Xiao said: 'Formerly Bo Yi managed livestock for Shun. The livestock greatly multiplied, so he was given land and granted the surname Ying. Now their descendants also multiply horses for me. I will divide land as a fief for them.' He enfeoffed him at Qin, had him continue the Ying clan sacrifices, and titled him Qin Ying. He also did not discard Shen Hou's daughter as Luo's proper wife, to harmonize with the western Rong.

sentences.zh: 秦嬴生秦侯。

translations.literal: Qin Ying gave birth Qin Hou.
translations.idiomatic: Qin Ying gave birth to Qin Hou.

sentences.zh: 秦侯立十年，卒。

translations.literal: Qin Hou established ten years, died.
translations.idiomatic: Qin Hou ruled for ten years and died.

sentences.zh: 生公伯。

translations.literal: Gave birth Gong Bo.
translations.idiomatic: He gave birth to Gong Bo.

sentences.zh: 公伯立三年，卒。

translations.literal: Gong Bo established three years, died.
translations.idiomatic: Gong Bo ruled for three years and died.

sentences.zh: 生秦仲。

translations.literal: Gave birth Qin Zhong.
translations.idiomatic: He gave birth to Qin Zhong.

translations.literal: Qin Ying gave birth to Qin Hou. Qin Hou was established for ten years and died. He gave birth to Gong Bo. Gong Bo was established for three years and died. He gave birth to Qin Zhong.

sentences.zh: 秦仲立三年，周厲王無道，諸侯或叛之。

translations.literal: Qin Zhong established three years, Zhou Li Wang without way, feudal lords some rebelled him.
translations.idiomatic: Qin Zhong ruled for three years. King Li of Zhou was tyrannical, and some of the feudal lords rebelled against him.

sentences.zh: 西戎反王室，滅犬丘大駱之族。

translations.literal: Western Rong rebelled royal house, extinguished Quan Qiu Da Luo clan.
translations.idiomatic: The western Rong rebelled against the royal house and extinguished the Quan Qiu Da Luo clan.

sentences.zh: 周宣王即位，乃以秦仲為大夫，誅西戎。

translations.literal: Zhou Xuan Wang took throne, then with Qin Zhong as grand master, executed western Rong.
translations.idiomatic: When King Xuan of Zhou took the throne, he made Qin Zhong a grand master and sent him to execute the western Rong.

sentences.zh: 西戎殺秦仲。

translations.literal: Western Rong killed Qin Zhong.
translations.idiomatic: The western Rong killed Qin Zhong.

sentences.zh: 秦仲立二十三年，死於戎。

translations.literal: Qin Zhong established twenty-three years, died among Rong.
translations.idiomatic: Qin Zhong ruled for twenty-three years and died among the Rong.

sentences.zh: 有子五人，其長者曰莊公。

translations.literal: Had five sons, his eldest called Zhuang Gong.
translations.idiomatic: He had five sons, and the eldest was named Zhuang Gong.

sentences.zh: 周宣王乃召莊公昆弟五人，與兵七千人，使伐西戎，破之。

translations.literal: Zhou Xuan Wang then summoned Zhuang Gong brothers five people, gave troops seven thousand, made attack western Rong, broke them.
translations.idiomatic: King Xuan of Zhou then summoned Zhuang Gong and his four brothers, gave them seven thousand troops, and sent them to attack the western Rong, where they defeated them.

sentences.zh: 於是復予秦仲後，及其先大駱地犬丘并有之，為西垂大夫。

translations.literal: Thus again gave Qin Zhong descendants, and their ancestor Da Luo land Quan Qiu together possessed it, as western frontier grand master.
translations.idiomatic: So he again granted Qin Zhong's descendants the lands, including their ancestor Da Luo's territory at Quan Qiu, and made him the grand master of the western frontier.

translations.literal: Qin Zhong was established for three years. King Li of Zhou was without the Way. Some feudal lords rebelled against him. The western Rong rebelled against the royal house and extinguished the Quanqiu Da Luo clan. King Xuan of Zhou took the throne. He made Qin Zhong a grand master to execute the western Rong. The western Rong killed Qin Zhong. Qin Zhong was established for twenty-three years and died among the Rong. He had five sons. His eldest was called Zhuang Gong. King Xuan of Zhou then summoned Zhuang Gong and his four brothers, gave them seven thousand troops, and had them attack the western Rong. They broke them. Thus he again gave to Qin Zhong's descendants, and they together possessed their ancestor Da Luo's land of Quanqiu, as grand master of the western frontier.

sentences.zh: 莊公居其故西犬丘，生子三人，其長男世父。

translations.literal: Zhuang Gong resided his former western Quan Qiu, gave birth three sons, his eldest son Shi Fu.
translations.idiomatic: Zhuang Gong resided in his former territory at western Quan Qiu. He had three sons, and the eldest was named Shi Fu.

sentences.zh: 世父曰：「戎殺我大父仲，我非殺戎王則不敢入邑。」

translations.literal: Shi Fu said: 'Rong killed my grandfather Zhong, I not kill Rong king then dare not enter city.'
translations.idiomatic: Shi Fu said, 'The Rong killed my grandfather Zhong. I will not dare enter the city unless I kill the Rong king.'

sentences.zh: 遂將擊戎，讓其弟襄公。

translations.literal: Then would attack Rong, yielded to his younger brother Xiang Gong.
translations.idiomatic: So he was about to attack the Rong, but yielded to his younger brother Xiang Gong.

sentences.zh: 襄公為太子。

translations.literal: Xiang Gong became crown prince.
translations.idiomatic: Xiang Gong became the crown prince.

sentences.zh: 莊公立四十四年，卒，太子襄公代立。

translations.literal: Zhuang Gong established forty-four years, died, crown prince Xiang Gong succeeded.
translations.idiomatic: Zhuang Gong ruled for forty-four years and died. The crown prince Xiang Gong succeeded him.

sentences.zh: 襄公元年，以女弟繆嬴為豐王妻。

translations.literal: Xiang Gong first year, with younger sister Mu Ying as Feng Wang wife.
translations.idiomatic: In Xiang Gong's first year, he gave his younger sister Mu Ying as wife to the King of Feng.

sentences.zh: 襄公二年，戎圍犬丘，（世父）世父擊之，為戎人所虜。

translations.literal: Xiang Gong second year, Rong surrounded Quan Qiu, Shi Fu attacked them, was Rong people captured.
translations.idiomatic: In Xiang Gong's second year, the Rong surrounded Quan Qiu. Shi Fu attacked them but was captured by the Rong.

sentences.zh: 歲餘，復歸世父。

translations.literal: Year more, again returned Shi Fu.
translations.idiomatic: After more than a year, Shi Fu was returned again.

sentences.zh: 七年春，周幽王用褒姒廢太子，立褒姒子為適，數欺諸侯，諸侯叛之。

translations.literal: Seventh year spring, Zhou You Wang used Bao Si deposed crown prince, established Bao Si son as proper, repeatedly deceived feudal lords, feudal lords rebelled him.
translations.idiomatic: In the seventh year, spring, King You of Zhou, influenced by Bao Si, deposed the crown prince and established Bao Si's son as the proper heir. He repeatedly deceived the feudal lords, and the feudal lords rebelled against him.

sentences.zh: 西戎犬戎與申侯伐周，殺幽王酈山下。

translations.literal: Western Rong Quan Rong with Shen Hou attacked Zhou, killed You Wang Li Mountain below.
translations.idiomatic: The western Rong, the Quan Rong, together with Lord Shen attacked Zhou and killed King You below Li Mountain.

sentences.zh: 而秦襄公將兵救周，戰甚力，有功。

translations.literal: But Qin Xiang Gong led troops saved Zhou, fought very hard, had merit.
translations.idiomatic: But Lord Xiang of Qin led troops to save Zhou, fought very fiercely, and achieved merit.

sentences.zh: 周避犬戎難，東徙雒邑，襄公以兵送周平王。

translations.literal: Zhou avoided Quan Rong difficulty, east moved Luo city, Xiang Gong with troops escorted Zhou Ping Wang.
translations.idiomatic: Zhou avoided the Quan Rong difficulty and moved east to Luo city. Lord Xiang escorted King Ping of Zhou with his troops.

sentences.zh: 平王封襄公為諸侯，賜之岐以西之地。

translations.literal: Ping Wang enfeoffed Xiang Gong as feudal lord, granted him Qi west lands.
translations.idiomatic: King Ping enfeoffed Lord Xiang as a feudal lord and granted him the lands west of Qi.

sentences.zh: 曰：「戎無道，侵奪我岐、豐之地，秦能攻逐戎，即有其地。」

translations.literal: Said: 'Rong without way, invaded seized my Qi, Feng lands, Qin can attack expel Rong, then have their land.'
translations.idiomatic: He said, 'The Rong are without principle and have invaded and seized my lands of Qi and Feng. If Qin can attack and expel the Rong, then Qin may have those lands.'

sentences.zh: 與誓，封爵之。

translations.literal: Made oath, enfeoffed nobility him.
translations.idiomatic: He made an oath with him and enfeoffed him with noble rank.

sentences.zh: 襄公於是始國，與諸侯通使聘享之禮，乃用騮駒、黃牛、羝羊各三，祠上帝西畤。

translations.literal: Xiang Gong thus began state, with feudal lords communicated envoys marriage hosting rites, then used liu colt, yellow ox, ram each three, sacrificed to Heaven western altar.
translations.idiomatic: Lord Xiang thus established his state and communicated with the feudal lords through envoys and the rites of marriage and hosting. He then used three liu colts, three yellow oxen, and three rams to sacrifice to Heaven at the western altar.

sentences.zh: 十二年，伐戎而至岐，卒。

translations.literal: Twelfth year, attacked Rong and reached Qi, died.
translations.idiomatic: In the twelfth year, he attacked the Rong and reached Qi, then died.

sentences.zh: 生文公。

translations.literal: Gave birth Wen Gong.
translations.idiomatic: He gave birth to Wen Gong.

translations.literal: Zhuang Gong resided at his former western Quanqiu. He had three sons. His eldest son was Shi Fu. Shi Fu said: 'The Rong killed my grandfather Zhong. I will not dare enter the city unless I kill the Rong king.' He then would attack the Rong but yielded to his younger brother Xiang Gong. Xiang Gong became the crown prince. Zhuang Gong was established for forty-four years. He died. Crown prince Xiang Gong succeeded him. In Xiang Gong's first year, he gave his younger sister Mu Ying as wife to the king of Feng. In Xiang Gong's second year, the Rong surrounded Quanqiu. Shi Fu attacked them but was captured by the Rong people. After more than a year, Shi Fu returned again. In spring of the seventh year, King You of Zhou used Bao Si to depose the crown prince and establish Bao Si's son as the proper heir. He repeatedly deceived the feudal lords. The feudal lords rebelled against him. The western Rong Quanrong, together with Shen Hou, attacked Zhou and killed King You below Mount Li. But Duke Xiang of Qin led troops to save Zhou. He fought very hard and had merit. Zhou avoided the Quanrong difficulty and moved east to Luoyi. Xiang Gong escorted King Ping of Zhou with his troops. King Ping enfeoffed Xiang Gong as a feudal lord and granted him the lands west of Mount Qi. He said: 'The Rong are without the Way. They have invaded and seized my Qi and Feng lands. If Qin can attack and expel the Rong, then Qin will have their lands.' They made an oath and enfeoffed him with nobility. Xiang Gong thus began his state. He communicated with the feudal lords through envoys and marriage and hosting rites. He then used three liu colts, three yellow oxen, and three rams to sacrifice to Heaven at the western altar. In the twelfth year, he attacked the Rong and reached Mount Qi, then died. He gave birth to Wen Gong.

sentences.zh: 文公元年，居西垂宮。

translations.literal: Wen Gong first year, resided western frontier palace.
translations.idiomatic: In Wen Gong's first year, he resided in the western frontier palace.

sentences.zh: 三年，文公以兵七百人東獵。

translations.literal: Third year, Wen Gong with troops seven hundred people east hunted.
translations.idiomatic: In the third year, Wen Gong went east hunting with seven hundred troops.

sentences.zh: 四年，至汧渭之會。

translations.literal: Fourth year, reached Qian Wei confluence.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourth year, he reached the confluence of the Qian and Wei rivers.

sentences.zh: 曰：「昔周邑我先秦嬴於此，後卒獲為諸侯。」

translations.literal: Said: 'Formerly Zhou enfeoffed my ancestor Qin Ying here, afterwards finally obtained as feudal lord.'
translations.idiomatic: He said, 'Formerly Zhou enfeoffed my ancestor Qin Ying here, and afterwards we finally obtained status as feudal lords.'

sentences.zh: 乃卜居之，占曰吉，即營邑之。

translations.literal: Then divined residence there, omen said auspicious, immediately built city there.
translations.idiomatic: He then divined about residing there. The omen was auspicious, so he immediately built a city there.

sentences.zh: 十年，初為鄜畤，用三牢。

translations.literal: Tenth year, initially made Fu altar, used three sets of sacrificial animals.
translations.idiomatic: In the tenth year, he initially established the Fu altar, using three sets of sacrificial animals.

sentences.zh: 十三年，初有史以紀事，民多化者。

translations.literal: Thirteenth year, initially had scribe to record affairs, people many civilized.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirteenth year, he initially had a scribe to record affairs, and many of the people became civilized.

sentences.zh: 十六年，文公以兵伐戎，戎敗走。

translations.literal: Sixteenth year, Wen Gong with troops attacked Rong, Rong defeated fled.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixteenth year, Wen Gong attacked the Rong with troops. The Rong were defeated and fled.

sentences.zh: 於是文公遂收周餘民有之，地至岐，岐以東獻之周。

translations.literal: Thus Wen Gong then gathered Zhou remaining people possessed them, land to Qi, Qi east offered to Zhou.
translations.idiomatic: So Wen Gong then gathered the remaining Zhou people and possessed them. The land reached Qi, and he offered the lands east of Qi to Zhou.

sentences.zh: 十九年，得陳寶。

translations.literal: Nineteenth year, obtained Chen treasure.
translations.idiomatic: In the nineteenth year, he obtained the Chen treasure.

sentences.zh: 二十年，法初有三族之罪。

translations.literal: Twentieth year, law initially had three clans crime.
translations.idiomatic: In the twentieth year, the law initially had the crime of the three clans.

sentences.zh: 二十七年，伐南山大梓，豐大特。

translations.literal: Twenty-seventh year, attacked south mountain great catalpa, abundant great special.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-seventh year, he attacked the great catalpa trees of South Mountain—abundant and very large.

sentences.zh: 四十八年，文公太子卒，賜謚為竫公。

translations.literal: Forty-eighth year, Wen Gong crown prince died, granted posthumous title Ruo Gong.
translations.idiomatic: In the forty-eighth year, Wen Gong's crown prince died and was granted the posthumous title Ruo Gong.

sentences.zh: 竫公之長子為太子，是文公孫也。

translations.literal: Ruo Gong eldest son became crown prince, this Wen Gong grandson also.
translations.idiomatic: Ruo Gong's eldest son became the crown prince—this was also Wen Gong's grandson.

sentences.zh: 五十年，文公卒，葬西山。

translations.literal: Fiftieth year, Wen Gong died, buried west mountain.
translations.idiomatic: In the fiftieth year, Wen Gong died and was buried at West Mountain.

sentences.zh: 竫公子立，是為寧公。

translations.literal: Ruo Gong son established, this was Ning Gong.
translations.idiomatic: Ruo Gong's son took the throne—this was Ning Gong.

translations.literal: In Wen Gong's first year, he resided at the western frontier palace. In the third year, Wen Gong went east hunting with seven hundred troops. In the fourth year, he reached the confluence of the Qian and Wei rivers. He said: 'Formerly Zhou enfeoffed my ancestor Qin Ying here. Afterwards he finally obtained the status of feudal lord.' He then divined about residing there. The omen was auspicious. He immediately built a city there. In the tenth year, he initially made the Fu altar, using three sets of sacrificial animals. In the thirteenth year, he initially had scribes to record affairs. Many people became civilized. In the sixteenth year, Wen Gong attacked the Rong with troops. The Rong were defeated and fled. Thus Wen Gong then gathered the Zhou remnant people and possessed them. The land went to Mount Qi. He offered what was east of Mount Qi to Zhou. In the nineteenth year, he obtained the Chen treasure. In the twentieth year, the law initially had the crime of the three clans. In the twenty-seventh year, he attacked the great catalpa of South Mountain and had abundant special offerings. In the forty-eighth year, Wen Gong's crown prince died. He was granted the posthumous title of Ruo Gong. Ruo Gong's eldest son became the crown prince. He was also Wen Gong's grandson. In the fiftieth year, Wen Gong died. He was buried at West Mountain. Ruo Gong's son was established. He was Ning Gong.

sentences.zh: 寧公二年，公徙居平陽。

translations.literal: Ning Gong second year, duke moved resided Pingyang.
translations.idiomatic: In Ning Gong's second year, the duke moved and resided at Pingyang.

sentences.zh: 遣兵伐蕩社。

translations.literal: Sent troops attacked Dang She.
translations.idiomatic: He sent troops to attack Dang She.

sentences.zh: 三年，與亳戰，亳王奔戎，遂滅蕩社。

translations.literal: Third year, with Bo fought, Bo king fled to Rong, then extinguished Dang She.
translations.idiomatic: In the third year, he fought with Bo. The King of Bo fled to the Rong, and Qin then extinguished Dang She.

sentences.zh: 四年，魯公子翬弒其君隱公。

translations.literal: Fourth year, Lu Gong Zi Hui assassinated their ruler Yin Gong.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourth year, the Gong Zi Hui of Lu assassinated his ruler Yin Gong.

sentences.zh: 十二年，伐蕩氏，取之。

translations.literal: Twelfth year, attacked Dang clan, took it.
translations.idiomatic: In the twelfth year, he attacked the Dang clan and took it.

sentences.zh: 寧公生十歲立，立十二年卒，葬西山。

translations.literal: Ning Gong born ten years established, established twelve years died, buried west mountain.
translations.idiomatic: Ning Gong was ten years old when he took the throne. He ruled for twelve years and died, and was buried at West Mountain.

sentences.zh: 生子三人，長男武公為太子。

translations.literal: Gave birth three sons, eldest son Wu Gong became crown prince.
translations.idiomatic: He had three sons, and the eldest, Wu Gong, became the crown prince.

sentences.zh: 武公弟德公，同母魯姬子。

translations.literal: Wu Gong younger brother De Gong, same mother Lu Ji son.
translations.idiomatic: Wu Gong's younger brother was De Gong, a son of the same mother, Lady Lu Ji.

sentences.zh: 生出子。

translations.literal: Gave birth Chu Zi.
translations.idiomatic: She gave birth to Chu Zi.

sentences.zh: 寧公卒，大庶長弗忌、威壘、三父廢太子而立出子為君。

translations.literal: Ning Gong died, grand minister Fu Ji, Wei Lei, San Fu deposed crown prince and established Chu Zi as ruler.
translations.idiomatic: When Ning Gong died, the grand minister Fu Ji, Wei Lei, and San Fu deposed the crown prince and established Chu Zi as ruler.

sentences.zh: 出子六年，三父等復共令人賊殺出子。

translations.literal: Chu Zi sixth year, San Fu etc. again together made person assassin kill Chu Zi.
translations.idiomatic: In Chu Zi's sixth year, San Fu and the others again conspired to have assassins kill Chu Zi.

sentences.zh: 出子生五歲立，立六年卒。

translations.literal: Chu Zi born five years established, established six years died.
translations.idiomatic: Chu Zi was five years old when he took the throne. He ruled for six years and died.

sentences.zh: 三父等乃復立故太子武公。

translations.literal: San Fu etc. then again established former crown prince Wu Gong.
translations.idiomatic: San Fu and the others then again established the former crown prince Wu Gong.

translations.literal: In Ning Gong's second year, the duke moved and resided at Pingyang. He sent troops to attack Dangshe. In the third year, he fought with Bo. The king of Bo fled to the Rong. He then extinguished Dangshe. In the fourth year, Gong Zi Hui of Lu assassinated their ruler Duke Yin. In the twelfth year, he attacked the Dang clan and took it. Ning Gong was established at age ten. He was established for twelve years and died. He was buried at West Mountain. He had three sons. His eldest son Wu Gong became the crown prince. Wu Gong's younger brother was De Gong. They had the same mother, Lu Ji. She gave birth to Chu Zi. Ning Gong died. The grand minister Fu Ji, Wei Lei, and San Fu deposed the crown prince and established Chu Zi as ruler. In Chu Zi's sixth year, San Fu and the others again together had someone assassinate and kill Chu Zi. Chu Zi was established at age five. He was established for six years and died. San Fu and the others then again established the former crown prince Wu Gong.

sentences.zh: 武公元年，伐彭戲氏，至于華山下，居平陽封宮。

translations.literal: Wu Gong first year, attacked Peng Xi clan, reached Hua Mountain below, resided Pingyang Feng palace.
translations.idiomatic: In Wu Gong's first year, he attacked the Peng Xi clan, reaching below Hua Mountain, and resided in the Pingyang Feng palace.

sentences.zh: 三年，誅三父等而夷三族，以其殺出子也。

translations.literal: Third year, executed San Fu etc. and exterminated three clans, because they killed Chu Zi.
translations.idiomatic: In the third year, he executed San Fu and the others and exterminated their three clans, because they had killed Chu Zi.

sentences.zh: 鄭高渠瞇殺其君昭公。

translations.literal: Zheng Gao Qu Mi killed their ruler Zhao Gong.
translations.idiomatic: Gao Qu Mi of Zheng killed his ruler Zhao Gong.

sentences.zh: 十年，伐邽、冀戎，初縣之。

translations.literal: Tenth year, attacked Gui, Ji Rong, initially made counties.
translations.idiomatic: In the tenth year, he attacked the Gui and Ji Rong and initially made them into counties.

sentences.zh: 十一年，初縣杜、鄭。

translations.literal: Eleventh year, initially made Du, Zheng counties.
translations.idiomatic: In the eleventh year, he initially made Du and Zheng into counties.

sentences.zh: 滅小虢。

translations.literal: Extinguished small Guo.
translations.idiomatic: He extinguished the small state of Guo.

translations.literal: In Wu Gong's first year, he attacked the Pengxi clan and reached below Mount Hua. He resided at the Feng palace in Pingyang. In the third year, he executed San Fu and the others and exterminated their three clans, because they had killed Chu Zi. Gao Qu Mi of Zheng killed their ruler Duke Zhao. In the tenth year, he attacked the Rong of Gui and Ji, and initially made them counties. In the eleventh year, he initially made Du and Zheng into counties. He extinguished small Guo.

sentences.zh: 十三年，齊人管至父、連稱等殺其君襄公而立公孫無知。

translations.literal: Thirteenth year, Qi people Guan Zhi Fu, Lian Cheng etc. killed their ruler Xiang Gong and established Gong Sun Wu Zhi.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirteenth year, the Qi people Guan Zhi Fu, Lian Cheng, and others killed their ruler Xiang Gong and established Gong Sun Wu Zhi.

sentences.zh: 晉滅霍、魏、耿。

translations.literal: Jin extinguished Huo, Wei, Geng.
translations.idiomatic: Jin extinguished Huo, Wei, and Geng.

sentences.zh: 齊雍廩殺無知、管至父等而立齊桓公。

translations.literal: Qi Yong Lin killed Wu Zhi, Guan Zhi Fu etc. and established Qi Huan Gong.
translations.idiomatic: Qi Yong Lin killed Wu Zhi, Guan Zhi Fu, and the others and established Duke Huan of Qi.

sentences.zh: 齊、晉為彊國。

translations.literal: Qi, Jin became strong states.
translations.idiomatic: Qi and Jin became strong states.

translations.literal: In the thirteenth year, Guan Zhi Fu, Lian Cheng, and others of Qi killed their ruler Duke Xiang and established Gong Sun Wu Zhi. Jin extinguished Huo, Wei, and Geng. Yong Lin of Qi killed Wu Zhi and Guan Zhi Fu and the others, and established Duke Huan of Qi. Qi and Jin became strong states.

sentences.zh: 十九年，晉曲沃始為晉侯。

translations.literal: Nineteenth year, Jin Qu Wo began as Jin Hou.
translations.idiomatic: In the nineteenth year, Jin Qu Wo began to serve as the Marquis of Jin.

sentences.zh: 齊桓公伯於鄄。

translations.literal: Qi Huan Gong was Bo at Juan.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Huan of Qi became the Bo (hegemon) at Juan.

translations.literal: In the nineteenth year, Quwo of Jin began as Jin Hou. Duke Huan of Qi was Bo at Juan.

sentences.zh: 二十年，武公卒，葬雍平陽。

translations.literal: Twentieth year, Wu Gong died, buried Yong Pingyang.
translations.idiomatic: In the twentieth year, Wu Gong died and was buried at Yong Pingyang.

sentences.zh: 初以人從死，從死者六十六人。

translations.literal: Initially with people followed death, followers in death sixty-six people.
translations.idiomatic: He initially had people follow him in death, with sixty-six people following him to the grave.

sentences.zh: 有子一人，名曰白，白不立，封平陽。

translations.literal: Had one son, named Bai, Bai not established, enfeoffed Pingyang.
translations.idiomatic: He had one son named Bai. Bai was not established as ruler, but was enfeoffed at Pingyang.

sentences.zh: 立其弟德公。

translations.literal: Established his younger brother De Gong.
translations.idiomatic: He established his younger brother De Gong.

translations.literal: In the twentieth year, Wu Gong died. He was buried at Yong Pingyang. Initially people followed him in death. Those who followed in death were sixty-six people. He had one son named Bai. Bai was not established. He was enfeoffed at Pingyang. His younger brother De Gong was established.

sentences.zh: 德公元年，初居雍城大鄭宮。

translations.literal: De Gong first year, initially resided Yong city great Zheng palace.
translations.idiomatic: In De Gong's first year, he initially resided in the great Zheng palace in Yong city.

sentences.zh: 以犧三百牢祠鄜畤。

translations.literal: With three hundred victims sacrificed Fu altar.
translations.idiomatic: He sacrificed three hundred victims at the Fu altar.

sentences.zh: 卜居雍。

translations.literal: Divined residence Yong.
translations.idiomatic: He divined about residing in Yong.

sentences.zh: 後子孫飲馬於河。

translations.literal: Later descendants drink horses at river.
translations.idiomatic: Later, his descendants would water their horses at the Yellow River.

sentences.zh: 梁伯、芮伯來朝。

translations.literal: Liang Bo, Rui Bo came court.
translations.idiomatic: The Bo of Liang and the Bo of Rui came to court.

sentences.zh: 二年，初伏，以狗御蠱。

translations.literal: Second year, initially fu, with dogs drove away gu.
translations.idiomatic: In the second year, he initially performed the fu sacrifice, using dogs to drive away gu (poisonous vapors).

sentences.zh: 德公生三十三歲而立，立二年卒。

translations.literal: De Gong born thirty-three years established, established two years died.
translations.idiomatic: De Gong was thirty-three years old when he took the throne. He ruled for two years and died.

sentences.zh: 生子三人：長子宣公，中子成公，少子穆公。

translations.literal: Gave birth three sons: eldest son Xuan Gong, middle son Cheng Gong, youngest son Mu Gong.
translations.idiomatic: He had three sons: the eldest Xuan Gong, the middle son Cheng Gong, and the youngest Mu Gong.

sentences.zh: 長子宣公立。

translations.literal: Eldest son Xuan Gong established.
translations.idiomatic: The eldest son, Xuan Gong, took the throne.

translations.literal: In De Gong's first year, he initially resided at the great Zheng palace in Yong city. He sacrificed three hundred victims at the Fu altar. He divined about residing at Yong. Later descendants would drink their horses at the river. The Bo of Liang and the Bo of Rui came to court. In the second year, he initially performed the fu sacrifice, using dogs to drive away gu. De Gong was established at age thirty-three. He was established for two years and died. He had three sons: the eldest Xuan Gong, the middle Cheng Gong, the youngest Mu Gong. The eldest son Xuan Gong was established.

sentences.zh: 宣公元年，衛、燕伐周，出惠王，立王子穨。

translations.literal: Xuan Gong first year, Wei, Yan attacked Zhou, expelled Hui Wang, established Prince Sui.
translations.idiomatic: In Xuan Gong's first year, Wei and Yan attacked Zhou, expelled King Hui, and established Prince Sui.

sentences.zh: 三年，鄭伯、虢叔殺子穨而入惠王。

translations.literal: Third year, Zheng Bo, Guo Shu killed Zi Sui and entered Hui Wang.
translations.idiomatic: In the third year, the Bo of Zheng and Uncle Guo killed Zi Sui and reinstated King Hui.

sentences.zh: 四年，作密畤。

translations.literal: Fourth year, made Mi altar.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourth year, he established the Mi altar.

sentences.zh: 與晉戰河陽，勝之。

translations.literal: With Jin fought Heyang, defeated them.
translations.idiomatic: He fought with Jin at Heyang and defeated them.

sentences.zh: 十二年，宣公卒。

translations.literal: Twelfth year, Xuan Gong died.
translations.idiomatic: In the twelfth year, Xuan Gong died.

sentences.zh: 生子九人，莫立，立其弟成公。

translations.literal: Gave birth nine sons, none established, established his younger brother Cheng Gong.
translations.idiomatic: He had nine sons, but none were established as ruler. He established his younger brother Cheng Gong instead.

translations.literal: In Xuan Gong's first year, Wei and Yan attacked Zhou, expelled King Hui, and established Prince Sui. In the third year, the Bo of Zheng and Guo Shu killed Zi Sui and entered King Hui. In the fourth year, he made the Mi altar. He fought with Jin at Heyang and defeated them. In the twelfth year, Xuan Gong died. He had nine sons. None were established. His younger brother Cheng Gong was established.

sentences.zh: 成公元年，梁伯、芮伯來朝。

translations.literal: Cheng Gong first year, Liang Bo, Rui Bo came court.
translations.idiomatic: In Cheng Gong's first year, the Bo of Liang and the Bo of Rui came to court.

sentences.zh: 齊桓公伐山戎，次于孤竹。

translations.literal: Qi Huan Gong attacked Shan Rong, halted at Gu Zhu.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Huan of Qi attacked the Shan Rong and halted at Gu Zhu.

translations.literal: In Cheng Gong's first year, the Bo of Liang and the Bo of Rui came to court. Duke Huan of Qi attacked the Shanrong and halted at Guzhu.

sentences.zh: 成公立四年卒。

translations.literal: Cheng Gong established four years died.
translations.idiomatic: Cheng Gong ruled for four years and died.

sentences.zh: 子七人，莫立，立其弟繆公。

translations.literal: Sons seven people, none established, established his younger brother Mu Gong.
translations.idiomatic: He had seven sons, but none were established as ruler. He established his younger brother Mu Gong instead.

translations.literal: Cheng Gong was established for four years and died. He had seven sons. None were established. His younger brother Mu Gong was established.

sentences.zh: 繆公任好元年，自將伐茅津，勝之。

translations.literal: Mu Gong Ren Hao first year, personally led attacked Mao Jin, defeated them.
translations.idiomatic: In the first year of Mu Gong Ren Hao, he personally led an attack on Mao Jin and defeated them.

sentences.zh: 四年，迎婦於晉，晉太子申生姊也。

translations.literal: Fourth year, welcomed wife from Jin, Jin crown prince Shen Sheng sister also.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourth year, he welcomed a wife from Jin—she was also the sister of Jin's crown prince Shen Sheng.

sentences.zh: 其歲，齊桓公伐楚，至邵陵。

translations.literal: That year, Qi Huan Gong attacked Chu, reached Shao Ling.
translations.idiomatic: That year, Duke Huan of Qi attacked Chu and reached Shao Ling.

translations.literal: In Mu Gong Ren Hao's first year, he personally led an attack on Maojin and defeated them. In the fourth year, he welcomed a wife from Jin. She was also the sister of Jin's crown prince Shen Sheng. That year, Duke Huan of Qi attacked Chu and reached Shaoling.

sentences.zh: 五年，晉獻公滅虞、虢，虜虞君與其大夫百里傒，以璧馬賂於虞故也。

translations.literal: Fifth year, Jin Xian Gong extinguished Yu, Guo, captured Yu ruler and his grand master Bai Li Xi, because jade horse bribed Yu reason.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifth year, Duke Xian of Jin extinguished Yu and Guo, capturing the ruler of Yu and his grand master Bai Li Xi. This was because of the jade and horses that had been used to bribe Yu.

sentences.zh: 既虜百里傒，以為秦繆公夫人媵於秦。

translations.literal: Already captured Bai Li Xi, made Qin Mu Gong lady attendant to Qin.
translations.idiomatic: Having already captured Bai Li Xi, he made him an attendant to the wife of Duke Mu of Qin.

sentences.zh: 百里傒亡秦走宛，楚鄙人執之。

translations.literal: Bai Li Xi fled Qin went Wan, Chu border person seized him.
translations.idiomatic: Baili Xi fled from Qin and went to Wan, where a Chu border official seized him.

sentences.zh: 繆公聞百里傒賢，欲重贖之，恐楚人不與，乃使人謂楚曰：「吾媵臣百里傒在焉，請以五羖羊皮贖之。」

translations.literal: Mu Gong heard Bai Li Xi worthy, wished heavily ransom him, feared Chu people not give, then made person tell Chu said: 'My attendant minister Bai Li Xi is there, please with five black sheep skins ransom him.'
translations.idiomatic: Duke Mu heard that Baili Xi was worthy and wished to ransom him at a high price, but feared the Chu people would not give him up. So he sent someone to tell Chu, 'My attendant minister Baili Xi is there. Please allow me to ransom him with five black sheep skins.'

sentences.zh: 楚人遂許與之。

translations.literal: Chu people then permitted gave him.
translations.idiomatic: The Chu people then agreed to give him up.

sentences.zh: 當是時，百里傒年已七十餘。

translations.literal: When this time, Bai Li Xi age already seventy remaining.
translations.idiomatic: At this time, Baili Xi was already over seventy years old.

sentences.zh: 繆公釋其囚，與語國事。

translations.literal: Mu Gong released his prisoner, with him spoke state affairs.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Mu released him from prison and spoke with him about state affairs.

sentences.zh: 謝曰：「臣亡國之臣，何足問！」

translations.literal: Declined said: 'Minister perished state minister, what worth ask!'
translations.idiomatic: He declined, saying, 'I am a minister of a perished state—what is there worth asking me about!'

sentences.zh: 繆公曰：「虞君不用子，故亡，非子罪也。」

translations.literal: Mu Gong said: 'Yu ruler not used you, therefore perished, not your crime also.'
translations.idiomatic: Duke Mu said, 'The ruler of Yu did not employ you, which is why Yu perished. It was not your crime.'

sentences.zh: 固問，語三日，繆公大說，授之國政，號曰五羖大夫。

translations.literal: Insistently asked, spoke three days, Mu Gong greatly pleased, granted him state government, titled five black sheep grand master.
translations.idiomatic: He insisted on asking, and they spoke for three days. Duke Mu was greatly pleased and granted him control of state affairs, titling him the Five Black Sheep Grand Master.

sentences.zh: 百里傒讓曰：「臣不及臣友蹇叔，蹇叔賢而世莫知。

translations.literal: Bai Li Xi declined said: 'Minister not equal minister friend Jian Shu, Jian Shu worthy but world none know.
translations.idiomatic: Baili Xi declined, saying, 'I am not equal to my friend Jian Shu. Jian Shu is worthy, but the world does not know it.'

sentences.zh: 臣常游困於齊而乞食铚人，蹇叔收臣。

translations.literal: Minister often wandered destitute in Qi and begged food from Zhi people, Jian Shu took in minister.
translations.idiomatic: I often wandered destitute in Qi and begged food from people of Zhi, and Jian Shu took me in.

sentences.zh: 臣因而欲事齊君無知，蹇叔止臣，臣得脫齊難，遂之周。

translations.literal: Minister therefore wished to serve Qi ruler Wu Zhi, Jian Shu stopped minister, minister got free from Qi difficulty, then went to Zhou.
translations.idiomatic: Therefore I wished to serve Duke Wu Zhi of Qi, but Jian Shu stopped me. I escaped from the Qi disaster and went to Zhou.

sentences.zh: 周王子穨好牛，臣以養牛干之。

translations.literal: Zhou prince Zi Sui liked oxen, minister with raising oxen sought him.
translations.idiomatic: Prince Zi Sui of Zhou liked oxen, so I sought his favor by raising oxen.

sentences.zh: 及穨欲用臣，蹇叔止臣，臣去，得不誅。

translations.literal: When Zi Sui wished to use minister, Jian Shu stopped minister, minister left, got not executed.
translations.idiomatic: When Zi Sui wished to employ me, Jian Shu stopped me. I left and avoided execution.

sentences.zh: 事虞君，蹇叔止臣。

translations.literal: Served Yu ruler, Jian Shu stopped minister.
translations.idiomatic: When I served the ruler of Yu, Jian Shu stopped me.

sentences.zh: 臣知虞君不用臣，臣誠私利祿爵，且留。

translations.literal: Minister knew Yu ruler would not use minister, minister truly privately benefited salary rank, and stayed.
translations.idiomatic: I knew the ruler of Yu would not employ me, but I truly benefited privately from salary and rank, and stayed.

sentences.zh: 再用其言，得脫，一不用，及虞君難：是以知其賢。」

translations.literal: Twice used his words, got free, once not used, met Yu ruler difficulty: this is why know his worthiness.'
translations.idiomatic: Twice I used his words and escaped, once I did not use them and met the Yu ruler's difficulty. This is why I know his worthiness.'

sentences.zh: 於是繆公使人厚幣迎蹇叔，以為上大夫。

translations.literal: Thus Mu Gong made person rich gifts welcome Jian Shu, made him upper grand master.
translations.idiomatic: Thus Duke Mu sent someone with generous gifts to welcome Jian Shu and made him an Upper Grand Master.

translations.literal: In the fifth year, Duke Xian of Jin extinguished Yu and Guo, captured the Yu ruler and his grand master Baili Xi, because of the jade and horse bribe to Yu. Having captured Baili Xi, he made him an attendant to Qin Mu Gong's lady. Baili Xi fled Qin and went to Wan. A Chu border person seized him. Mu Gong heard Baili Xi was worthy and wished to heavily ransom him. He feared the Chu people would not give him, so he had someone tell Chu: 'My attendant minister Baili Xi is there. Please ransom him with five black sheep skins.' . The Chu people then permitted and gave him. At this time, Baili Xi was already over seventy years old. Mu Gong released his prisoner and spoke with him about state affairs. He declined and said: 'I am a minister of a perished state. What am I worth asking!' Mu Gong said: 'The Yu ruler did not use you, therefore perished. It was not your crime.' He insisted on asking. They spoke for three days. Mu Gong was greatly pleased and granted him state government, titling him the Five Black Sheep Grand Master. Baili Xi declined and said: 'I am not equal to my friend Jianshu. Jianshu is worthy but the world does not know him. I often wandered destitute in Qi and begged food from the people of Zhi. Jianshu took me in. Therefore I wished to serve the Qi ruler Wu Zhi. Jianshu stopped me. I escaped the Qi disaster and went to Zhou. Prince Zi Sui of Zhou liked oxen. I sought him by raising oxen. When Zi Sui wished to use me, Jianshu stopped me. I left and escaped execution. I served the Yu ruler. Jianshu stopped me. I knew the Yu ruler would not use me. I truly stayed for private benefit of salary and rank. Twice I used his words and escaped. Once I did not use them and met with the Yu ruler's disaster. This is why I know his worthiness.' Thus Mu Gong sent someone with rich gifts to welcome Jianshu and made him an upper grand master.

sentences.zh: 秋，繆公自將伐晉，戰於河曲。

translations.literal: Autumn, Mu Gong personally led attacked Jin, fought at He Qu.
translations.idiomatic: In autumn, Duke Mu personally led an attack on Jin and fought at Hequ.

sentences.zh: 晉驪姬作亂，太子申生死新城，重耳、夷吾出奔。

translations.literal: Jin Li Ji made rebellion, crown prince Shen Sheng died Xin Cheng, Chong Er, Yi Wu fled.
translations.idiomatic: Lady Li Ji of Jin made rebellion, Crown Prince Shen Sheng died in Xincheng, and Chong'er and Yiwu fled.

translations.literal: In autumn, Mu Gong personally led an attack on Jin and fought at Hequ. Li Ji of Jin made rebellion. Crown prince Shen Sheng died at Xin Cheng. Chong'er and Yiwu fled.

sentences.zh: 九年，齊桓公會諸侯於葵丘。

translations.literal: Ninth year, Qi Huan Gong assembled feudal lords at Kui Qiu.
translations.idiomatic: In the ninth year, Duke Huan of Qi assembled the feudal lords at Kuiqiu.

translations.literal: In the ninth year, Duke Huan of Qi assembled the feudal lords at Kuiqiu.

sentences.zh: 晉獻公卒。

translations.literal: Jin Xian Gong died.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Xian of Jin died.

sentences.zh: 立驪姬子奚齊，其臣里克殺奚齊。

translations.literal: Established Li Ji son Xi Qi, his minister Li Ke killed Xi Qi.
translations.idiomatic: They established Li Ji's son Xiqi, but his minister Like killed Xiqi.

sentences.zh: 荀息立卓子，克又殺卓子及荀息。

translations.literal: Xun Xi established Zhuo Zi, Ke again killed Zhuo Zi and Xun Xi.
translations.idiomatic: Xun Xi established Zhuo Zi, but Like again killed Zhuo Zi and Xun Xi.

sentences.zh: 夷吾使人請秦，求入晉。

translations.literal: Yi Wu made person request Qin, sought to enter Jin.
translations.idiomatic: Yiwu sent someone to request Qin and sought to enter Jin.

sentences.zh: 於是繆公許之，使百里傒將兵送夷吾。

translations.literal: Thus Mu Gong permitted it, made Bai Li Xi lead troops send Yi Wu.
translations.idiomatic: Thus Duke Mu permitted it and had Baili Xi lead troops to escort Yiwu.

sentences.zh: 夷吾謂曰：「誠得立，請割晉之河西八城與秦。」

translations.literal: Yi Wu told him: 'Truly get established, please cut Jin river west eight cities give Qin.'
translations.idiomatic: Yiwu told him, 'If I truly get established, I will cede Jin's eight cities west of the river to Qin.'

sentences.zh: 及至，已立，而使丕鄭謝秦，背約不與河西城，而殺裏克。

translations.literal: When arrived, already established, and made Pi Zheng thank Qin, broke promise not gave river west cities, and killed Li Ke.
translations.idiomatic: When he arrived and was already established, he had Pi Zheng thank Qin but broke the promise and did not give the cities west of the river, and he killed Like.

sentences.zh: 丕鄭聞之，恐，因與繆公謀曰：「晉人不欲夷吾，實欲重耳。

translations.literal: Pi Zheng heard it, feared, therefore with Mu Gong plotted said: 'Jin people not want Yi Wu, truly want Chong Er.
translations.idiomatic: Pi Zheng heard this and feared. Therefore he plotted with Duke Mu, saying, 'The Jin people do not want Yiwu; they truly want Chong'er.'

sentences.zh: 今背秦約而殺裏克，皆呂甥、郤芮之計也。

translations.literal: Now break Qin promise and kill Li Ke, all Lu Sheng, Xi Rui strategy also.
translations.idiomatic: Now breaking the Qin promise and killing Like—all this is the strategy of Lu Sheng and Xi Rui.'

sentences.zh: 願君以利急召呂、郤，呂、郤至，則更入重耳便。」

translations.literal: Wish ruler with benefit urgently summon Lu, Xi, Lu, Xi arrive, then change enter Chong Er convenient.'
translations.idiomatic: I wish you would urgently summon Lü and Xi with benefits. When Lü and Xi arrive, then it will be convenient to change and enter Chong'er.'

sentences.zh: 繆公許之，使人與丕鄭歸，召呂、郤。

translations.literal: Mu Gong permitted it, made person with Pi Zheng return, summoned Lu, Xi.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Mu permitted it and had someone return with Pi Zheng to summon Lü and Xi.

sentences.zh: 呂、郤等疑丕鄭有閒，乃言夷吾殺丕鄭。

translations.literal: Lu, Xi etc. suspected Pi Zheng had rift, then said Yi Wu killed Pi Zheng.
translations.idiomatic: Lü, Xi, and the others suspected Pi Zheng had a rift and then said that Yiwu killed Pi Zheng.

sentences.zh: 丕鄭子丕豹奔秦，說繆公曰：「晉君無道，百姓不親，可伐也。」

translations.literal: Pi Zheng son Pi Bao fled Qin, persuaded Mu Gong said: 'Jin ruler without way, common people not close, can attack also.'
translations.idiomatic: Pi Zheng's son Pi Bao fled to Qin and persuaded Duke Mu, saying, 'The Jin ruler is without the Way, the common people are not close to him—it can be attacked.'

sentences.zh: 繆公曰：「百姓茍不便，何故能誅其大臣？

translations.literal: Mu Gong said: 'Common people if not convenient, why able execute their grand ministers?
translations.idiomatic: Duke Mu said, 'If the common people are not convenient, why would he be able to execute his grand ministers?'

sentences.zh: 能誅其大臣，此其調也。」

translations.literal: Able execute their grand ministers, this their harmony also.'
translations.idiomatic: Able to execute their grand ministers—this shows their harmony.'

sentences.zh: 不聽，而陰用豹。

translations.literal: Not listened, and secretly used Bao.
translations.idiomatic: He did not listen, but secretly employed Bao.

translations.literal: Duke Xian of Jin died. They established Li Ji's son Xi Qi. His minister Li Ke killed Xi Qi. Xun Xi established Zhuo Zi. Ke again killed Zhuo Zi and Xun Xi. Yiwu sent someone to request Qin, seeking to enter Jin. Thus Mu Gong permitted it and had Baili Xi lead troops to send Yiwu. Yiwu told him: 'If I truly get established, please cut off eight cities west of the river from Jin and give them to Qin.' When he arrived and was already established, he had Pi Zheng thank Qin. He broke the promise and did not give the cities west of the river. He killed Li Ke. Pi Zheng heard this and feared. Therefore he plotted with Mu Gong and said: 'The Jin people do not want Yiwu. They truly want Chong'er. Now breaking the Qin promise and killing Li Ke was all the strategy of Lü Sheng and Xi Rui.' I wish you would urgently summon Lü and Xi with benefits. When Lü and Xi arrive, then changing to enter Chong'er would be convenient.' Mu Gong permitted it and sent someone to return with Pi Zheng to summon Lü and Xi. Lü, Xi, and others suspected Pi Zheng had a rift. They then said that Yiwu killed Pi Zheng. Pi Zheng's son Pi Bao fled to Qin and persuaded Mu Gong saying: 'The Jin ruler has no way. The common people are not close to him. We can attack.' Mu Gong said: 'If the common people were not convenient, why would they be able to execute their grand ministers? Being able to execute their grand ministers shows their harmony.' He did not listen but secretly used Bao.

sentences.zh: 十二年，齊管仲、隰朋死。

translations.literal: Twelfth year, Qi Guan Zhong, Xi Peng died.
translations.idiomatic: In the twelfth year, Guan Zhong and Xi Peng of Qi died.

translations.literal: In the twelfth year, Guan Zhong and Xi Peng of Qi died.

sentences.zh: 晉旱，來請粟。

translations.literal: Jin drought, came request grain.
translations.idiomatic: Jin had a drought and came requesting grain.

sentences.zh: 丕豹說繆公勿與，因其饑而伐之。

translations.literal: Pi Bao persuaded Mu Gong not give, because their hunger and attack them.
translations.idiomatic: Pi Bao persuaded Duke Mu not to give it, but to attack them because of their hunger.

sentences.zh: 繆公問公孫支，支曰：「饑穰更事耳，不可不與。」

translations.literal: Mu Gong asked Gong Sun Zhi, Zhi said: 'Hunger abundance alternate matters ear, cannot not give.'
translations.idiomatic: Duke Mu asked Gongsun Zhi, who said, 'Hunger and abundance are just alternating matters—it cannot be that we not give.'

sentences.zh: 問百里傒，傒曰：「夷吾得罪於君，其百姓何罪？」

translations.literal: Asked Bai Li Xi, Xi said: 'Yi Wu offended ruler, his common people what crime?'
translations.idiomatic: He asked Baili Xi, who said, 'Yiwu offended the ruler—what crime have his common people committed?'

sentences.zh: 於是用百里傒、公孫支言，卒與之粟。

translations.literal: Thus used Bai Li Xi, Gong Sun Zhi words, finally gave them grain.
translations.idiomatic: Thus he used the words of Baili Xi and Gongsun Zhi and finally gave them grain.

sentences.zh: 以船漕車轉，自雍相望至絳。

translations.literal: With boats transported carts transported, from Yong mutually saw to Jiang.
translations.idiomatic: They transported it by boat and cart, with people seeing each other from Yong all the way to Jiang.

translations.literal: Jin had drought and came to request grain. Pi Bao persuaded Mu Gong not to give it, but to attack them because of their hunger. Mu Gong asked Gong Sun Zhi. Zhi said: 'Hunger and abundance are alternating matters. We cannot not give.' He asked Baili Xi. Xi said: 'Yiwu offended the ruler. What crime did his common people commit?' Thus he used the words of Baili Xi and Gong Sun Zhi and finally gave them grain. They transported it by boat and cart. From Yong they could see each other all the way to Jiang.

sentences.zh: 十四年，秦饑，請粟於晉。

translations.literal: Fourteenth year, Qin famine, requested grain from Jin.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourteenth year, Qin had a famine and requested grain from Jin.

sentences.zh: 晉君謀之群臣。

translations.literal: Jin ruler consulted his group ministers.
translations.idiomatic: The Jin ruler consulted with his ministers.

sentences.zh: 虢射曰：「因其饑伐之，可有大功。」

translations.literal: Guo She said: 'Because their hunger attack them, can have great merit.'
translations.idiomatic: Guo She said, 'Attack them because of their hunger—it can bring great merit.'

sentences.zh: 晉君從之。

translations.literal: Jin ruler followed it.
translations.idiomatic: The Jin ruler followed this advice.

sentences.zh: 十五年，興兵將攻秦。

translations.literal: Fifteenth year, raised troops will attack Qin.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifteenth year, they raised troops and were about to attack Qin.

sentences.zh: 繆公發兵，使丕豹將，自往擊之。

translations.literal: Mu Gong sent troops, made Pi Bao lead, personally went strike them.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Mu sent troops, had Pi Bao lead them, and personally went to strike them.

sentences.zh: 九月壬戌，與晉惠公夷吾合戰於韓地。

translations.literal: Ninth month Ren Xu, with Jin Hui Gong Yi Wu joined battle at Han land.
translations.idiomatic: On the Renxu day of the ninth month, they joined battle with Duke Hui of Jin, Yiwu, at Han territory.

sentences.zh: 晉君棄其軍，與秦爭利，還而馬騺。

translations.literal: Jin ruler abandoned his army, with Qin contended benefit, returned and horse stumbled.
translations.idiomatic: The Jin ruler abandoned his army, contended for advantage with Qin, but on his return his horse stumbled.

sentences.zh: 繆公與麾下馳追之，不能得晉君，反為晉軍所圍。

translations.literal: Mu Gong with banner under galloped pursued him, could not get Jin ruler, instead by Jin army surrounded.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Mu and his banner-bearers galloped after him but could not capture the Jin ruler. Instead, they were surrounded by the Jin army.

sentences.zh: 晉擊繆公，繆公傷。

translations.literal: Jin struck Mu Gong, Mu Gong wounded.
translations.idiomatic: The Jin forces struck Duke Mu, wounding him.

sentences.zh: 於是岐下食善馬者三百人馳冒晉軍，晉軍解圍，遂脫繆公而反生得晉君。

translations.literal: Thus Qi below ate good horse ones three hundred people galloped braved Jin army, Jin army broke siege, then freed Mu Gong and instead captured Jin ruler alive.
translations.idiomatic: Thus the three hundred men from below Qi who had eaten Duke Mu's good horse galloped forth and braved the Jin army. The Jin army broke the siege, thus freeing Duke Mu and instead capturing the Jin ruler alive.

sentences.zh: 初，繆公亡善馬，岐下野人共得而食之者三百餘人，吏逐得，欲法之。

translations.literal: Initially, Mu Gong lost good horse, Qi below wild men together got and ate it ones three hundred remaining people, officials pursued got, wished punish them.
translations.idiomatic: Initially, Duke Mu had lost a good horse. More than three hundred men from the wilds below Qi together found it and ate it. Officials pursued and captured them, wishing to punish them according to the law.

sentences.zh: 繆公曰：「君子不以畜產害人。

translations.literal: Mu Gong said: 'Gentleman not with livestock harm people.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Mu said, 'A gentleman does not harm people over livestock.'

sentences.zh: 吾聞食善馬肉不飲酒，傷人。」

translations.literal: I heard eat good horse meat not drink wine, harms people.'
translations.idiomatic: I have heard that eating good horse meat without drinking wine harms people.'

sentences.zh: 乃皆賜酒而赦之。

translations.literal: Then all granted wine and pardoned them.
translations.idiomatic: He then granted wine to all of them and pardoned them.

sentences.zh: 三百人者聞秦擊晉，皆求從，從而見繆公窘，亦皆推鋒爭死，以報食馬之德。

translations.literal: Three hundred people heard Qin struck Jin, all sought to follow, followed and saw Mu Gong distressed, also all pushed spear contended death, to repay ate horse virtue.
translations.idiomatic: When these three hundred men heard that Qin was attacking Jin, they all sought to follow. They followed and saw Duke Mu in distress, so they all pushed forward with their spears and contended to die, to repay the virtue of eating the horse.

sentences.zh: 於是繆公虜晉君以歸，令於國，齊宿，吾將以晉君祠上帝。

translations.literal: Thus Mu Gong captured Jin ruler to return, ordered in state, prepared lodging, I will with Jin ruler sacrifice to Heaven.
translations.idiomatic: Thus Duke Mu captured the Jin ruler and returned. He ordered preparations in the state and prepared lodging, saying, 'I will sacrifice the Jin ruler to Heaven.'

sentences.zh: 周天子聞之，曰「晉我同姓」，為請晉君。

translations.literal: Zhou Son of Heaven heard it, said 'Jin I same surname', for requested Jin ruler.
translations.idiomatic: The Zhou Son of Heaven heard of it and said, 'Jin is of the same surname as I.' He requested the Jin ruler on their behalf.

sentences.zh: 夷吾姊亦為繆公夫人，夫人聞之，乃衰绖跣，曰：「妾兄弟不能相救，以辱君命。」

translations.literal: Yi Wu sister also was Mu Gong lady, lady heard it, then mourning garments hemp shoes barefoot, said: 'Concubine brothers cannot mutually save, to disgrace ruler command.'
translations.idiomatic: Yiwu's sister was also Duke Mu's lady. The lady heard of it and put on mourning garments with hemp cords and went barefoot, saying, 'My brothers cannot save each other, bringing disgrace to the ruler's command.'

sentences.zh: 繆公曰：「我得晉君以為功，今天子為請，夫人是憂。」

translations.literal: Mu Gong said: 'I got Jin ruler as merit, now Son of Heaven for requests, lady this worries.'
translations.idiomatic: Duke Mu said, 'I took the Jin ruler as merit, but now the Son of Heaven requests him on their behalf. This worries the lady.'

sentences.zh: 乃與晉君盟，許歸之，更舍上舍，而饋之七牢。

translations.literal: Then with Jin ruler allied, permitted return him, changed lodged upper lodging, and fed him seven sets.
translations.idiomatic: He then allied with the Jin ruler and permitted his return, changed his lodging to an upper chamber, and fed him seven sets of sacrificial animals.

sentences.zh: 十一月，歸晉君夷吾，夷吾獻其河西地，使太子圉為質於秦。

translations.literal: Eleventh month, returned Jin ruler Yi Wu, Yi Wu offered his river west land, made crown prince Yu be hostage in Qin.
translations.idiomatic: In the eleventh month, he returned the Jin ruler Yiwu. Yiwu offered his lands west of the river and had Crown Prince Yu serve as hostage in Qin.

sentences.zh: 秦妻子圉以宗女。

translations.literal: Qin married Yu with clan daughter.
translations.idiomatic: Qin married Yu to a daughter of the ruling clan.

sentences.zh: 是時秦地東至河。

translations.literal: This time Qin land east to river.
translations.idiomatic: At this time, Qin's territory extended east to the Yellow River.

translations.literal: The Rong king sent You Yu to Qin. You Yu's ancestors were Jin people. He fled and entered the Rong, and could speak the Jin language. Having heard Mu Gong was worthy, he therefore sent You Yu to observe Qin. Qin Mu Gong showed him the palaces and accumulations. You Yu said: 'If ghosts made it, then it would labor the spirits. If people made it, it would also embitter the people.' Mu Gong was astonished and asked: 'China uses poetry, books, ritual, music, and laws to govern, yet there is still occasional chaos. Now the Rong and Yi have none of this. What do they govern with? Is it not difficult?' You Yu laughed and said: 'This is precisely why China is chaotic. Since the supreme sage Yellow Emperor created ritual, music, and laws, and led by example himself, he barely achieved a small measure of order. When it came to his later generations, they became increasingly arrogant and licentious. They blocked the authority of the laws and used them to demand and supervise from below. When the lower people became utterly exhausted, they resented and hoped for benevolence and righteousness from above. Ruler and subject mutually contended and resented each other, leading to usurpation and assassination, even to the extinction of clans. All of this is of this category. The Rong and Yi are not like this. The superiors contain pure virtue in treating their inferiors. The inferiors cherish loyalty and faith in serving their superiors. A state's government is like governing one body. They don't know how they govern - this is truly the governance of sages.' Thus Mu Gong withdrew and asked Inner Scribe Liao: 'I have heard that neighboring states having sages is the worry of enemy states. Now You Yu is worthy. He is my harm. What shall I do?' Inner Scribe Liao said: 'The Rong king dwells in remote seclusion and has not heard the sounds of China. Your majesty should try sending him female musicians to seize his will; make requests for You Yu to loosen the space between them; detain him and not send him back, to make him miss his deadline. The Rong king will find it strange and must suspect You Yu. When there is space between ruler and minister, then we can capture him. Moreover, the Rong king likes music and must neglect his governance.' Mu Gong said: 'Good.' Therefore he sat with You Yu on curved mats and ate by passing vessels. He asked about the terrain and troop dispositions and examined everything. Then he commanded Inner Scribe Liao to send sixteen female musicians to the Rong king. The Rong king received them and was pleased. He did not return for a whole year. Thus Qin then returned You Yu. You Yu admonished several times but was not listened to. Mu Gong again several times had people secretly intercept You Yu. You Yu then left and surrendered to Qin. Mu Gong treated him with guest rituals and asked about the form of attacking the Rong.
