translations.literal: Ai Gong eighth year, Chu Gong Zi Qi Ji assassinated Ling Wang and self established, this was Ping Wang.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Ai's eighth year, Prince Qi Ji of Chu assassinated King Ling and established himself on the throne—this was King Ping.

sentences.zh: 十一年，楚平王來求秦女為太子建妻。

translations.literal: Eleventh year, Chu Ping Wang came requested Qin woman for crown prince Jian wife.
translations.idiomatic: In the eleventh year, King Ping of Chu came and requested a Qin woman to be the wife of Crown Prince Jian.

sentences.zh: 至國，女好而自娶之。

translations.literal: Arrived state, woman beautiful and self married her.
translations.idiomatic: Upon arriving in the state, the woman was beautiful and he married her himself.

sentences.zh: 十五年，楚平王欲誅建，建亡；

translations.literal: Fifteenth year, Chu Ping Wang wished execute Jian, Jian fled;
translations.idiomatic: In the fifteenth year, King Ping of Chu wished to execute Jian, and Jian fled;

sentences.zh: 伍子胥奔吳。

translations.literal: Wu Zi Xu fled Wu.
translations.idiomatic: Wu Zixu fled to Wu.

sentences.zh: 晉公室卑而六卿彊，欲內相攻，是以久秦晉不相攻。

translations.literal: Jin ducal house low and six ministers strong, wished internal mutually attack, this is why long Qin Jin not mutually attack.
translations.idiomatic: The Jin ducal house was weak while the six ministers were strong, and they wished to attack each other internally, which is why Qin and Jin did not attack each other for a long time.

sentences.zh: 三十一年，吳王闔閭與伍子胥伐楚，楚王亡奔隨，吳遂入郢。

translations.literal: Thirty-first year, Wu king He Lu with Wu Zi Xu attacked Chu, Chu king fled went Sui, Wu then entered Ying.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-first year, King Helü of Wu, together with Wu Zixu, attacked Chu. The Chu king fled and went to Sui, and Wu then entered Ying.

sentences.zh: 楚大夫申包胥來告急，七日不食，日夜哭泣。

translations.literal: Chu grand master Shen Bao Xu came reported urgent, seven days not eat, day night wept cried.
translations.idiomatic: The Chu grand master Shen Bao Xu came to report the urgency, going seven days without eating, weeping and crying day and night.

sentences.zh: 於是秦乃發五百乘救楚，敗吳師。

translations.literal: Thus Qin then sent five hundred chariots rescued Chu, defeated Wu troops.
translations.idiomatic: Thus Qin then sent five hundred chariots to rescue Chu and defeated the Wu troops.

sentences.zh: 吳師歸，楚昭王乃得復入郢。

translations.literal: Wu troops returned, Chu Zhao Wang then got again enter Ying.
translations.idiomatic: The Wu troops returned, and King Zhao of Chu was then able to re-enter Ying.

sentences.zh: 哀公立三十六年卒。

translations.literal: Ai Gong established thirty-six years died.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Ai ruled for thirty-six years and died.

sentences.zh: 太子夷公，夷公蚤死，不得立，立夷公子，是為惠公。

translations.literal: Crown prince Yi Gong, Yi Gong early died, not got established, established Yi Gong son, this was Hui Gong.
translations.idiomatic: The crown prince was Yi Gong. Yi Gong died early and did not get established. They established Yi Gong's son—this was Duke Hui.

translations.literal: In Ai Gong's eighth year, Gong Zi Qi Ji of Chu assassinated King Ling and established himself. He was King Ping. In the eleventh year, King Ping of Chu came to request a Qin woman as wife for Crown Prince Jian. When he arrived in the state, the woman was beautiful and he married her himself. In the fifteenth year, King Ping of Chu wished to execute Jian. Jian fled; Wu Zi Xu fled to Wu. The Jin ducal house was weak and the six ministers were strong. They wished to attack each other internally. This is why Qin and Jin long did not attack each other. In the thirty-first year, King He Lu of Wu with Wu Zi Xu attacked Chu. The Chu king fled to Sui. Wu then entered Ying. The Chu grand master Shen Bao Xu came to report the urgency. He did not eat for seven days and wept day and night. Thus Qin then sent five hundred chariots to rescue Chu and defeated the Wu troops. The Wu troops returned. King Zhao of Chu then was able to re-enter Ying. Ai Gong was established for thirty-six years and died. The crown prince was Yi Gong. Yi Gong died early and could not be established. They established Yi Gong's son. He was Hui Gong.

sentences.zh: 惠公元年，孔子行魯相事。

translations.literal: Hui Gong first year, Confucius carried out Lu chancellor affairs.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Hui's first year, Confucius carried out the affairs of chancellor of Lu.

sentences.zh: 五年，晉卿中行、范氏反晉，晉使智氏、趙簡子攻之，范、中行氏亡奔齊。

translations.literal: Fifth year, Jin ministers Zhong Xing, Fan clan rebelled Jin, Jin made Zhi clan, Zhao Jian Zi attacked them, Fan, Zhong Xing clan fled went Qi.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifth year, the Jin ministers Zhong Xing and the Fan clan rebelled against Jin. Jin had the Zhi clan and Zhao Jian Zi attack them, and the Fan and Zhong Xing clans fled and went to Qi.

sentences.zh: 惠公立十年卒，子悼公立。

translations.literal: Hui Gong established ten years died, son Dao Gong established.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Hui ruled for ten years and died; his son Duke Dao took the throne.

translations.literal: In Hui Gong's first year, Confucius carried out the chancellor's affairs in Lu. In the fifth year, the Jin ministers Zhong Xing and Fan clans rebelled against Jin. Jin had the Zhi clan and Zhao Jian Zi attack them. The Fan and Zhong Xing clans fled to Qi. Hui Gong was established for ten years and died. His son Dao Gong was established.

sentences.zh: 悼公二年，齊臣田乞弒其君孺子，立其兄陽生，是為悼公。

translations.literal: Dao Gong second year, Qi minister Tian Qi assassinated their ruler Ru Zi, established his brother Yang Sheng, this was Dao Gong.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Dao's second year, the Qi minister Tian Qi assassinated their ruler Ruzi and established his brother Yang Sheng—this was Duke Dao.

sentences.zh: 六年，吳敗齊師。

translations.literal: Sixth year, Wu defeated Qi troops.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixth year, Wu defeated the Qi troops.

sentences.zh: 齊人弒悼公，立其子簡公。

translations.literal: Qi people assassinated Dao Gong, established his son Jian Gong.
translations.idiomatic: The Qi people assassinated Duke Dao and established his son Duke Jian.

sentences.zh: 九年，晉定公與吳王夫差盟，爭長於黃池，卒先吳。

translations.literal: Ninth year, Jin Ding Gong with Wu king Fu Chai allied, contended seniority at Huang Chi, finally yielded to Wu.
translations.idiomatic: In the ninth year, Duke Ding of Jin allied with King Fuchai of Wu, contended for seniority at Huangchi, and finally yielded to Wu.

sentences.zh: 吳彊，陵中國。

translations.literal: Wu strong, overawed central states.
translations.idiomatic: Wu was strong and overawed the central states.

sentences.zh: 十二年，齊田常弒簡公，立其弟平公，常相之。

translations.literal: Twelfth year, Qi Tian Chang assassinated Jian Gong, established his brother Ping Gong, Chang became chancellor.
translations.idiomatic: In the twelfth year, Tian Chang of Qi assassinated Duke Jian and established his brother Duke Ping, with Chang becoming chancellor.

sentences.zh: 十三年，楚滅陳。

translations.literal: Thirteenth year, Chu extinguished Chen.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirteenth year, Chu extinguished Chen.

sentences.zh: 秦悼公立十四年卒，子厲共公立。

translations.literal: Qin Dao Gong established fourteen years died, son Li Gong Gong established.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Dao of Qin ruled for fourteen years and died; his son Duke Li Gong took the throne.

sentences.zh: 孔子以悼公十二年卒。

translations.literal: Confucius in Dao Gong twelfth year died.
translations.idiomatic: Confucius died in Duke Dao's twelfth year.

translations.literal: In Dao Gong's second year, the Qi minister Tian Qi assassinated their ruler Ru Zi and established his brother Yang Sheng. He was Duke Dao. In the sixth year, Wu defeated the Qi troops. The Qi people assassinated Duke Dao and established his son Duke Jian. In the ninth year, Duke Ding of Jin allied with King Fu Chai of Wu. They contended for seniority at Huangchi, and finally yielded to Wu. Wu was strong and overawed the central states. In the twelfth year, Tian Chang of Qi assassinated Duke Jian and established his brother Duke Ping. Chang became chancellor. In the thirteenth year, Chu extinguished Chen. Qin Dao Gong was established for fourteen years and died. His son Duke Li Gong was established. Confucius died in Dao Gong's twelfth year.

sentences.zh: 厲共公二年，蜀人來賂。

translations.literal: Li Gong Gong second year, Shu people came bribed.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Li Gong's second year, the Shu people came with bribes.

sentences.zh: 十六年，塹河旁。

translations.literal: Sixteenth year, moated river side.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixteenth year, they moated along the river side.

sentences.zh: 以兵二萬伐大荔，取其王城。

translations.literal: With troops twenty thousand attacked Da Li, took its king city.
translations.idiomatic: They attacked Dali with twenty thousand troops and took its king city.

sentences.zh: 二十一年，初縣頻陽。

translations.literal: Twenty-first year, initially made Pin Yang county.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-first year, they initially made Pinyang a county.

sentences.zh: 晉取武成。

translations.literal: Jin took Wu Cheng.
translations.idiomatic: Jin took Wucheng.

sentences.zh: 二十四年，晉亂，殺智伯，分其國與趙、韓、魏。

translations.literal: Twenty-fourth year, Jin chaos, killed Zhi Bo, divided his state with Zhao, Han, Wei.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-fourth year, there was chaos in Jin. They killed Zhi Bo and divided his state among Zhao, Han, and Wei.

sentences.zh: 二十五年，智開與邑人來奔。

translations.literal: Twenty-fifth year, Zhi Kai with town people came fled.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-fifth year, Zhi Kai and the town people came fleeing.

sentences.zh: 三十三年，伐義渠，虜其王。

translations.literal: Thirty-third year, attacked Yi Qu, captured their king.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-third year, they attacked Yiqu and captured their king.

sentences.zh: 三十四年，日食。

translations.literal: Thirty-fourth year, solar eclipse.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-fourth year, there was a solar eclipse.

sentences.zh: 厲共公卒，子躁公立。

translations.literal: Li Gong Gong died, son Zao Gong established.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Li Gong died, and his son Duke Zao took the throne.

translations.literal: In Duke Li Gong's second year, the Shu people came with bribes. In the sixteenth year, they built moats along the river. They attacked Dali with twenty thousand troops and took its royal city. In the twenty-first year, they initially made Pinyang a county. Jin took Wucheng. In the twenty-fourth year, Jin had chaos. They killed Zhi Bo and divided his state among Zhao, Han, and Wei. In the twenty-fifth year, Zhi Kai came fleeing with the town people. In the thirty-third year, they attacked Yiqu and captured their king. In the thirty-fourth year, there was a solar eclipse. Duke Li Gong died. His son Duke Zao was established.

sentences.zh: 躁公二年，南鄭反。

translations.literal: Zao Gong second year, Nan Zheng rebelled.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Zao's second year, Nanzheng rebelled.

sentences.zh: 十三年，義渠來伐，至渭南。

translations.literal: Thirteenth year, Yi Qu came attacked, reached Wei south.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirteenth year, Yiqu came to attack and reached south of the Wei.

sentences.zh: 十四年，躁公卒，立其弟懷公。

translations.literal: Fourteenth year, Zao Gong died, established his younger brother Huai Gong.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourteenth year, Duke Zao died, and they established his younger brother Duke Huai.

translations.literal: In Zao Gong's second year, Nanzheng rebelled. In the thirteenth year, Yiqu came to attack and reached south of the Wei. In the fourteenth year, Zao Gong died. They established his younger brother Duke Huai.

sentences.zh: 懷公四年，庶長朝與大臣圍懷公，懷公自殺。

translations.literal: Huai Gong fourth year, Shu Zhang Zhao with grand ministers surrounded Huai Gong, Huai Gong committed suicide.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Huai's fourth year, Shu Zhang Zhao and the grand ministers surrounded Duke Huai, and Duke Huai committed suicide.

sentences.zh: 懷公太子曰昭子，蚤死，大臣乃立太子昭子之子，是為靈公。

translations.literal: Huai Gong crown prince called Zhao Zi, early died, grand ministers then established crown prince Zhao Zi son, this was Ling Gong.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Huai's crown prince was called Zhao Zi. He died early, so the grand ministers then established Crown Prince Zhao Zi's son—this was Duke Ling.

sentences.zh: 靈公，懷公孫也。

translations.literal: Ling Gong, Huai Gong grandson.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Ling was Duke Huai's grandson.

translations.literal: In Huai Gong's fourth year, Shu Zhang Zhao and the grand ministers surrounded Huai Gong. Huai Gong committed suicide. Huai Gong's crown prince was called Zhao Zi. He died early. The grand ministers then established Zhao Zi's son. He was Ling Gong. Ling Gong was Huai Gong's grandson.

sentences.zh: 靈公六年，晉城少梁，秦擊之。

translations.literal: Ling Gong sixth year, Jin walled Shao Liang, Qin struck it.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Ling's sixth year, Jin walled Shaoliang, and Qin struck it.

sentences.zh: 十三年，城籍姑。

translations.literal: Thirteenth year, walled Ji Gu.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirteenth year, they walled Jigu.

sentences.zh: 靈公卒，子獻公不得立，立靈公季父悼子，是為簡公。

translations.literal: Ling Gong died, son Xian Gong not got established, established Ling Gong younger uncle Dao Zi, this was Jian Gong.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Ling died, and his son Duke Xian did not get established. They established Duke Ling's youngest uncle Dao Zi—this was Duke Jian.

sentences.zh: 簡公，昭子之弟而懷公子也。

translations.literal: Jian Gong, Zhao Zi younger brother and Huai Gong son.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Jian was Zhao Zi's younger brother and Duke Huai's son.

translations.literal: In Ling Gong's sixth year, Jin walled Shaoliang. Qin struck it. In the thirteenth year, they walled Jigu. Ling Gong died. His son Xian Gong could not be established. They established Ling Gong's younger uncle Dao Zi. He was Jian Gong. Jian Gong was Zhao Zi's younger brother and Huai Gong's son.

sentences.zh: 簡公六年，令吏初帶劍。

translations.literal: Jian Gong sixth year, commanded officials initially wore swords.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Jian's sixth year, he commanded officials to initially wear swords.

sentences.zh: 塹洛。

translations.literal: Moated Luo.
translations.idiomatic: They moated Luo.

sentences.zh: 城重泉。

translations.literal: Walled Chong Quan.
translations.idiomatic: They walled Chongquan.

sentences.zh: 十六年卒，子惠公立。

translations.literal: Sixteenth year died, son Hui Gong established.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixteenth year, he died, and his son Duke Hui took the throne.

translations.literal: In Jian Gong's sixth year, he commanded officials to initially wear swords. They built moats at Luo. They walled Chongquan. In the sixteenth year, he died. His son Hui Gong was established.

sentences.zh: 惠公十二年，子出子生。

translations.literal: Hui Gong twelfth year, son Chu Zi born.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Hui's twelfth year, his son Chu Zi was born.

sentences.zh: 十三年，伐蜀，取南鄭。

translations.literal: Thirteenth year, attacked Shu, took Nan Zheng.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirteenth year, they attacked Shu and took Nanzheng.

sentences.zh: 惠公卒，出子立。

translations.literal: Hui Gong died, Chu Zi established.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Hui died, and Chu Zi took the throne.

translations.literal: In Hui Gong's twelfth year, his son Chu Zi was born. In the thirteenth year, they attacked Shu and took Nanzheng. Hui Gong died. Chu Zi was established.

sentences.zh: 出子二年，庶長改迎靈公之子獻公于河西而立之。

translations.literal: Chu Zi second year, Shu Zhang Gai welcomed Ling Gong son Xian Gong from river west and established him.
translations.idiomatic: In Chu Zi's second year, Shu Zhang Gai welcomed Duke Ling's son Duke Xian from west of the river and established him on the throne.

sentences.zh: 殺出子及其母，沈之淵旁。

translations.literal: Killed Chu Zi and his mother, sank them beside the abyss.
translations.idiomatic: They killed Chu Zi and his mother, sinking them beside the abyss.

sentences.zh: 秦以往者數易君，君臣乖亂，故晉復彊，奪秦河西地。

translations.literal: Qin in past frequently changed rulers, ruler minister discordant chaotic, therefore Jin again strong, took Qin river west land.
translations.idiomatic: Qin had frequently changed rulers in the past, with ruler and minister in discordant chaos, so Jin grew strong again and took Qin's lands west of the river.

translations.literal: In Chu Zi's second year, Shu Zhang Gai welcomed Ling Gong's son Xian Gong from west of the river and established him. They killed Chu Zi and his mother and sank them beside the abyss. Qin in the past frequently changed rulers. Ruler and minister were discordant and chaotic. Therefore Jin became strong again and took Qin's land west of the river.

sentences.zh: 獻公元年，止從死。

translations.literal: Xian Gong first year, stopped following death.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Xian's first year, they stopped the practice of following in death.

sentences.zh: 二年，城櫟陽。

translations.literal: Second year, walled Yue Yang.
translations.idiomatic: In the second year, they walled Yueyang.

sentences.zh: 四年正月庚寅，孝公生。

translations.literal: Fourth year first month Geng Yin, Xiao Gong born.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourth year, first month, Gengyin day, Duke Xiao was born.

sentences.zh: 十一年，周太史儋見獻公曰：「周故與秦國合而別，別五百歲復合，合（七）十七歲而霸王出。」

translations.literal: Eleventh year, Zhou grand scribe Dan saw Xian Gong said: 'Zhou formerly with Qin state united and separated, separated five hundred years then united, united seventeen years and hegemon king emerges.'
translations.idiomatic: In the eleventh year, the Zhou grand scribe Dan saw Duke Xian and said, 'Zhou formerly united with the Qin state and then separated. Separated for five hundred years, they will unite again. United for seventeen years, and a hegemon king will emerge.'

sentences.zh: 十六年，桃冬花。

translations.literal: Sixteenth year, peach winter flowered.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixteenth year, peach trees flowered in winter.

sentences.zh: 十八年，雨金櫟陽。

translations.literal: Eighteenth year, rained gold Yue Yang.
translations.idiomatic: In the eighteenth year, gold rained in Yueyang.

sentences.zh: 二十一年，與晉戰於石門，斬首六萬，天子賀以黼黻。

translations.literal: Twenty-first year, with Jin fought at Shi Men, beheaded sixty thousand, Son of Heaven congratulated with fu fu.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-first year, they fought with Jin at Shimen, beheading sixty thousand. The Son of Heaven congratulated them with fu fu.

sentences.zh: 二十三年，與魏晉戰少梁，虜其將公孫痤。

translations.literal: Twenty-third year, with Wei Jin fought Shao Liang, captured their general Gong Sun Kuo.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-third year, they fought with Wei Jin at Shaoliang and captured their general Gongsun Kuo.

sentences.zh: 二十四年，獻公卒，子孝公立，年已二十一歲矣。

translations.literal: Twenty-fourth year, Xian Gong died, son Xiao Gong established, age already twenty-one years.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-fourth year, Duke Xian died, and his son Duke Xiao took the throne. He was already twenty-one years old.

translations.literal: In Xian Gong's first year, they stopped the practice of following in death. In the second year, they walled Yueyang. In the fourth year, first month, Gengyin day, Xiao Gong was born. In the eleventh year, Zhou's grand scribe Dan saw Xian Gong and said: 'Zhou formerly united with Qin state and then separated. Separated for five hundred years then united. United for seventeen years and a hegemon king will emerge.' In the sixteenth year, peaches flowered in winter. In the eighteenth year, it rained gold at Yueyang. In the twenty-first year, they fought with Jin at Shimen and beheaded sixty thousand. The Son of Heaven congratulated them with fufu robes. In the twenty-third year, they fought with Wei and Jin at Shaoliang and captured their general Gong Sun Kuo. In the twenty-fourth year, Xian Gong died. His son Xiao Gong was established. He was already twenty-one years old.

sentences.zh: 孝公元年，河山以東彊國六，與齊威、楚宣、魏惠、燕悼、韓哀、趙成侯并。

translations.literal: Xiao Gong first year, river mountain east strong states six, with Qi Wei, Chu Xuan, Wei Hui, Yan Dao, Han Ai, Zhao Cheng Hou equal.
translations.idiomatic: In Duke Xiao's first year, there were six strong states east of the river and mountains, equal with Qi Wei, Chu Xuan, Wei Hui, Yan Dao, Han Ai, and Zhao Cheng Hou.

sentences.zh: 淮泗之閒小國十餘。

translations.literal: Huai Si between small states ten remaining.
translations.idiomatic: Between the Huai and Si rivers were more than ten small states.

sentences.zh: 楚、魏與秦接界。

translations.literal: Chu, Wei with Qin adjoined borders.
translations.idiomatic: Chu and Wei adjoined borders with Qin.

sentences.zh: 魏筑長城，自鄭濱洛以北，有上郡。

translations.literal: Wei built long wall, from Zheng banked Luo north, had Shang commandery.
translations.idiomatic: Wei built the long wall, from Zheng along the Luo northward, and had Shang commandery.

sentences.zh: 楚自漢中，南有巴、黔中。

translations.literal: Chu from Han middle, south had Ba, Qian middle.
translations.idiomatic: Chu, from Hanzhong southward, had Ba and Qianzhong.

sentences.zh: 周室微，諸侯力政，爭相併。

translations.literal: Zhou house weak, feudal lords force governed, contended mutually annexed.
translations.idiomatic: The Zhou house was weak, the feudal lords governed by force, and contended to annex each other.

sentences.zh: 秦僻在雍州，不與中國諸侯之會盟，夷翟遇之。

translations.literal: Qin remote in Yong province, not with central states feudal lords assemblies alliances, Yi Di treated it.
translations.idiomatic: Qin was remote in Yong province, did not participate in the assemblies and alliances of the central states' feudal lords, and was treated as Yi and Di.

sentences.zh: 孝公於是布惠，振孤寡，招戰士，明功賞。

translations.literal: Xiao Gong thus spread favor, aided orphans widows, recruited warriors, clarified merit rewards.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Xiao thus spread favors, aided orphans and widows, recruited warriors, and clarified merit and rewards.

sentences.zh: 下令國中曰：「昔我繆公自岐雍之閒，修德行武，東平晉亂，以河為界，西霸戎翟，廣地千里，天子致伯，諸侯畢賀，為後世開業，甚光美。

translations.literal: Issued order in state said: 'Formerly our Mu Gong from Qi Yong between, cultivated virtue practiced martial, east pacified Jin chaos, with river as boundary, west hegemoned Rong Di, broadened land thousand li, Son of Heaven conferred Bo, feudal lords all congratulated, opened enterprise for later generations, very glorious beautiful.
translations.idiomatic: He issued an order in the state, saying, 'Formerly our Duke Mu, from between Qi and Yong, cultivated virtue and practiced martial affairs. In the east he pacified Jin's chaos, taking the river as boundary. In the west he became hegemon over the Rong and Di, broadening the land by a thousand li. The Son of Heaven conferred the title of Bo, and all the feudal lords congratulated him. He opened enterprises for later generations—very glorious and beautiful.'

sentences.zh: 會往者厲、躁、簡公、出子之不寧，國家內憂，未遑外事，三晉攻奪我先君河西地，諸侯卑秦、醜莫大焉。

translations.literal: Encountered previous Li, Zao, Jian Gong, Chu Zi unrest, state internal worries, not leisure external affairs, three Jin attacked seized our former rulers river west land, feudal lords belittled Qin, shame none greater.
translations.idiomatic: They encountered the previous unrest of Dukes Li, Zao, Jian, and Chu Zi. The state had internal worries and no leisure for external affairs. The three Jin attacked and seized our former rulers' lands west of the river. The feudal lords belittled Qin—there was no greater shame.'

sentences.zh: 獻公即位，鎮撫邊境，徙治櫟陽，且欲東伐，復繆公之故地，修繆公之政令。

translations.literal: Xian Gong ascended throne, pacified stabilized borders, moved capital Yue Yang, and wished east attack, recover Mu Gong former land, repair Mu Gong government orders.
translations.idiomatic: Duke Xian ascended the throne, pacified and stabilized the borders, moved the capital to Yueyang, and wished to attack eastward to recover Duke Mu's former lands and repair Duke Mu's government orders.

sentences.zh: 寡人思念先君之意，常痛於心。

translations.literal: I think of former rulers intention, constantly pained in heart.
translations.idiomatic: I think of the former rulers' intentions and am constantly pained in my heart.'

translations.literal: In Xiao Gong's first year, east of the rivers and mountains there were six strong states, equal to Qi Wei, Chu Xuan, Wei Hui, Yan Dao, Han Ai, and Zhao Cheng Hou. Between the Huai and Si there were over ten small states. Chu and Wei adjoined borders with Qin. Wei built the long wall, from Zheng along the Luo to the north, and had Shang commandery. Chu from Hanzhong south had Ba and Qianzhong. The Zhou house was weak. The feudal lords governed by force and contended to annex each other. Qin was remote in Yong province and did not participate in the assemblies and alliances of the central states' feudal lords. The Yi and Di treated it as such. Xiao Gong thus spread favors, aided orphans and widows, recruited warriors, and clarified merit and rewards. He issued an order in the state saying: 'Formerly our Mu Gong from between Qi and Yong cultivated virtue and practiced martial affairs. He pacified Jin chaos in the east with the river as boundary. He hegemoned the Rong and Di in the west and broadened the land by a thousand li. The Son of Heaven conferred the title of Bo. All the feudal lords congratulated him. He opened the enterprise for later generations. It was very glorious and beautiful. Encountering the unrest of the previous Li, Zao, Jian Gong, and Chu Zi, the state had internal worries and no leisure for external affairs. The three Jin attacked and seized our former rulers' land west of the river. The feudal lords belittled Qin. There was no greater shame. Xian Gong ascended the throne, pacified and stabilized the borders, moved the capital to Yueyang, and wished to attack east to recover Mu Gong's former land and repair Mu Gong's government orders. I think of the former rulers' intentions and am constantly pained in my heart. Any guest or minister who can produce extraordinary plans to strengthen Qin, I will moreover honor his office and divide land with him.' Thus he then sent troops to surround Xia city in the east and beheaded the Rong's Lian Wang in the west.

translations.idiomatic: Han, Wei, Qi, Chu, and Yue all came as guests in submission.

translations.literal: King Hui died. His son King Wu was established. Han, Wei, Qi, Chu, and Yue all followed as guests.

sentences.zh: 武王元年，與魏惠王會臨晉。

translations.literal: Wu Wang first year, with Wei Hui Wang met Lin Jin.
translations.idiomatic: In the first year of King Wu, he met with King Hui of Wei at Linjin.

sentences.zh: 誅蜀相壯。

translations.literal: Executed Shu chancellor Zhuang.
translations.idiomatic: They executed Shu's chancellor Zhuang.

sentences.zh: 張儀、魏章皆東出之魏。

translations.literal: Zhang Yi, Wei Zhang all east went to Wei.
translations.idiomatic: Zhang Yi and Wei Zhang both went east to Wei.

sentences.zh: 伐義渠、丹、犁。

translations.literal: Attacked Yi Qu, Dan, Li.
translations.idiomatic: They attacked Yiqu, Dan, and Li.

sentences.zh: 二年，初置丞相，摢裏疾、甘茂為左右丞相。

translations.literal: Second year, initially established chancellor, Mang Li Ji, Gan Mao as left right chancellors.
translations.idiomatic: In the second year, they initially established the position of chancellor, with Mang Li Ji and Gan Mao serving as left and right chancellors.

sentences.zh: 張儀死於魏。

translations.literal: Zhang Yi died in Wei.
translations.idiomatic: Zhang Yi passed away in Wei.

sentences.zh: 三年，與韓襄王會臨晉外。

translations.literal: Third year, with Han Xiang Wang met outside Lin Jin.
translations.idiomatic: In the third year, he met with King Xiang of Han outside Linjin.

sentences.zh: 南公揭卒，摢裏疾相韓。

translations.literal: Nan Gong Jie died, Mang Li Ji chancellor Han.
translations.idiomatic: Nan Gong Jie died, and Mang Li Ji became chancellor of Han.

sentences.zh: 武王謂甘茂曰：「寡人欲容車通三川，窺周室，死不恨矣。」

translations.literal: Wu Wang told Gan Mao said: 'I wish broad chariot pass San Chuan, peep Zhou room, die not regret.'
translations.idiomatic: King Wu said to Gan Mao, 'I wish to drive my broad chariot through the Three Rivers region and glimpse the Zhou royal domain. I would die without regret.'

sentences.zh: 其秋，使甘茂、庶長封伐宜陽。

translations.literal: That autumn, made Gan Mao, Shu Zhang Feng attack Yi Yang.
translations.idiomatic: That autumn, he had Gan Mao and Shu Zhang Feng attack Yiyang.

sentences.zh: 四年，拔宜陽，斬首六萬。

translations.literal: Fourth year, pulled Yi Yang, beheaded sixty thousand.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourth year, they captured Yiyang and beheaded sixty thousand.

sentences.zh: 涉河，城武遂。

translations.literal: Crossed river, walled Wu Sui.
translations.idiomatic: They crossed the river and walled Wusui.

sentences.zh: 魏太子來朝。

translations.literal: Wei crown prince came court.
translations.idiomatic: The crown prince of Wei came to court.

sentences.zh: 武王有力好戲，力士任鄙、烏獲、孟說皆至大官。

translations.literal: Wu Wang had strength liked play, strong men Ren Bi, Wu Huo, Meng Shuo all reached great official.
translations.idiomatic: King Wu was strong and enjoyed feats of strength. The strongmen Ren Bi, Wu Huo, and Meng Shuo all reached high office.

sentences.zh: 王與孟說舉鼎，絕臏。

translations.literal: King with Meng Shuo lifted ding, broke kneecap.
translations.idiomatic: The king competed with Meng Shuo in lifting a ding tripod, and broke his kneecap.

sentences.zh: 八月，武王死。

translations.literal: Eighth month, Wu Wang died.
translations.idiomatic: In the eighth month, King Wu died.

sentences.zh: 族孟說。

translations.literal: Clan Meng Shuo.
translations.idiomatic: They exterminated Meng Shuo's clan.

sentences.zh: 武王取魏女為后，無子。

translations.literal: Wu Wang took Wei woman as queen, no sons.
translations.idiomatic: King Wu had taken a woman of Wei as his queen, but she bore no sons.

sentences.zh: 立異母弟，是為昭襄王。

translations.literal: Established different mother younger brother, this was Zhao Xiang Wang.
translations.idiomatic: They established his younger half-brother, who became King Zhaoxiang.

sentences.zh: 昭襄母楚人，姓羋氏，號宣太后。

translations.literal: Zhao Xiang mother Chu person, surname Mi clan, titled Xuan Tai Hou.
translations.idiomatic: King Zhaoxiang's mother was a Chu native of the Mi clan, titled Xuan Taihou.

sentences.zh: 武王死時，昭襄王為質於燕，燕人送歸，得立。

translations.literal: Wu Wang died time, Zhao Xiang Wang was hostage in Yan, Yan people sent return, got established.
translations.idiomatic: When King Wu died, King Zhaoxiang was a hostage in Yan. The Yan people sent him back, and he was able to take the throne.

translations.literal: In King Wu's first year, he met with King Hui of Wei at Linjin. They executed Shu's chancellor Zhuang. Zhang Yi and Wei Zhang all went east to Wei. They attacked Yiqu, Dan, and Li. In the second year, they initially established the chancellor position, with Mang Li Ji and Gan Mao as left and right chancellors. Zhang Yi died in Wei. In the third year, he met with King Xiang of Han outside Linjin. Nan Gong Jie died. Mang Li Ji became chancellor of Han. King Wu told Gan Mao: 'I wish to have broad chariots pass through Sanchuan and peep at the Zhou chamber. I would die without regret.' That autumn, he had Gan Mao and Shu Zhang Feng attack Yiyang. In the fourth year, they pulled Yiyang and beheaded sixty thousand. They crossed the river and walled Wusui. The Wei crown prince came to court. King Wu had strength and liked play. The strong men Ren Bi, Wu Huo, and Meng Shuo all reached great official positions. The king lifted a ding with Meng Shuo and broke his kneecap. In the eighth month, King Wu died. They clanned Meng Shuo. King Wu took a Wei woman as queen. She had no sons. They established his different mother younger brother. He was King Zhao Xiang. King Zhao Xiang's mother was a Chu person of the Mi clan, titled Xuan Taihou. When King Wu died, King Zhao Xiang was a hostage in Yan. The Yan people sent him back and he got established.

sentences.zh: 昭襄王元年，嚴君疾為相。

translations.literal: Zhao Xiang Wang first year, Yan Jun Ji was chancellor.
translations.idiomatic: In the first year of King Zhaoxiang, Yan Jun Ji became chancellor.

sentences.zh: 甘茂出之魏。

translations.literal: Gan Mao went out to Wei.
translations.idiomatic: Gan Mao departed for Wei.

sentences.zh: 二年，彗星見。

translations.literal: Second year, comet seen.
translations.idiomatic: In the second year, a comet appeared.

sentences.zh: 庶長壯與大臣、諸侯、公子為逆，皆誅，及惠文后皆不得良死。

translations.literal: Shu Zhang Zhuang with grand ministers, feudal lords, gong zi rebelled, all executed, and Hui Wen queen all not got good death.
translations.idiomatic: Shu Zhang Zhuang conspired with high ministers, feudal lords, and princes in rebellion. They were all executed, as was Queen Huiwen, none meeting a good end.

sentences.zh: 悼武王后出歸魏。

translations.literal: Dao Wu Wang queen went out returned Wei.
translations.idiomatic: The Queen Dowager Dao of King Wu went out and returned to Wei.

sentences.zh: 三年，王冠。

translations.literal: Third year, king crowned.
translations.idiomatic: In the third year, the king was crowned.

sentences.zh: 與楚王會黃棘，與楚上庸。

translations.literal: With Chu king met Huang Ji, ceded Chu Shang Yong.
translations.idiomatic: He met with the King of Chu at Huangji and ceded Shangyong to Chu.

sentences.zh: 四年，取蒲阪。

translations.literal: Fourth year, took Pu Ban.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourth year, they took Puban.

sentences.zh: 彗星見。

translations.literal: Comet seen.
translations.idiomatic: A comet appeared.

sentences.zh: 五年，魏王來朝應亭，復與魏蒲阪。

translations.literal: Fifth year, Wei king came court Ying Ting, again gave Wei Pu Ban.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifth year, the King of Wei came to court at Yingteng, and they again gave Puban to Wei.

sentences.zh: 六年，蜀侯煇反，司馬錯定蜀。

translations.literal: Sixth year, Shu hou Hui rebelled, Si Ma Cuo pacified Shu.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixth year, the Marquis of Shu rebelled, and Sima Cuo pacified Shu.

sentences.zh: 庶長奐伐楚，斬首二萬。

translations.literal: Shu Zhang Huan attacked Chu, beheaded twenty thousand.
translations.idiomatic: Shu Zhang Huan attacked Chu and beheaded twenty thousand.

sentences.zh: 涇陽君質於齊。

translations.literal: Jing Yang Jun hostage in Qi.
translations.idiomatic: Lord Jingyang became a hostage in Qi.

sentences.zh: 日食，晝晦。

translations.literal: Solar eclipse, day dark.
translations.idiomatic: There was a solar eclipse, and the day grew dark.

sentences.zh: 七年，拔新城。

translations.literal: Seventh year, pulled Xin Cheng.
translations.idiomatic: In the seventh year, they captured Xincheng.

sentences.zh: 摢裏子卒。

translations.literal: Mang Li Zi died.
translations.idiomatic: Mang Li Zi passed away.

sentences.zh: 八年，使將軍羋戎攻楚，取新市。

translations.literal: Eighth year, made general Mi Rong attack Chu, took Xin Shi.
translations.idiomatic: In the eighth year, they sent General Mi Rong to attack Chu and take Xinshi.

sentences.zh: 齊使章子，魏使公孫喜，韓使暴鳶共攻楚方城，取唐眛。

translations.literal: Qi made Zhang Zi, Wei made Gong Sun Xi, Han made Bao Yuan together attacked Chu Fang Cheng, took Tang Mian.
translations.idiomatic: Qi sent Zhang Zi, Wei sent Gongsun Xi, and Han sent Bao Yuan. Together they attacked Chu's Fangcheng and took Tangmian.

sentences.zh: 趙破中山，其君亡，竟死齊。

translations.literal: Zhao broke Zhong Shan, its ruler fled, finally died Qi.
translations.idiomatic: Zhao destroyed Zhongshan. Its ruler fled and eventually died in Qi.

sentences.zh: 魏公子勁、韓公子長為諸侯。

translations.literal: Wei gong zi Jing, Han gong zi Chang became feudal lords.
translations.idiomatic: Prince Jing of Wei and Prince Chang of Han became feudal lords.

sentences.zh: 九年，孟嘗君薛文來相秦。

translations.literal: Ninth year, Meng Chang Jun Xue Wen came chancellor Qin.
translations.idiomatic: In the ninth year, Lord Mengchang Xue Wen came to serve as chancellor of Qin.

sentences.zh: 奐攻楚，取八城，殺其將景快。

translations.literal: Huan attacked Chu, took eight cities, killed their general Jing Kuai.
translations.idiomatic: Huan attacked Chu, took eight cities, and killed their general Jing Kuai.

sentences.zh: 十年，楚懷王入朝秦，秦留之。

translations.literal: Tenth year, Chu Huai Wang entered court Qin, Qin detained him.
translations.idiomatic: In the tenth year, King Huai of Chu came to Qin to pay court, and Qin detained him.

sentences.zh: 薛文以金受免。

translations.literal: Xue Wen with gold bribe dismissed.
translations.idiomatic: Xue Wen was dismissed through bribery with gold.

sentences.zh: 樓緩為丞相。

translations.literal: Lou Huan was chancellor.
translations.idiomatic: Lou Huan became chancellor.

sentences.zh: 十一年，齊、韓、魏、趙、宋、中山五國共攻秦，至鹽氏而還。

translations.literal: Eleventh year, Qi, Han, Wei, Zhao, Song, Zhong Shan five states together attacked Qin, reached Yan Shi and returned.
translations.idiomatic: In the eleventh year, Qi, Han, Wei, Zhao, Song, and Zhongshan-five states together attacked Qin, reached Yanshi, and returned.

sentences.zh: 秦與韓、魏河北及封陵以和。

translations.literal: Qin with Han, Wei north of Yellow River and Feng Ling to make peace.
translations.idiomatic: Qin made peace with Han and Wei, giving them the lands north of the Yellow River and Fengling.

sentences.zh: 彗星見。

translations.literal: Comet seen.
translations.idiomatic: A comet appeared.

sentences.zh: 楚懷王走之趙，趙不受，還之秦，即死，歸葬。

translations.literal: Chu Huai Wang fled to Zhao, Zhao not accepted, returned him to Qin, immediately died, returned for burial.
translations.idiomatic: King Huai of Chu fled to Zhao, but Zhao would not accept him. They returned him to Qin, where he immediately died, and his body was returned for burial.

sentences.zh: 十二年，樓緩免，穰侯魏冉為相。

translations.literal: Twelfth year, Lou Huan dismissed, Rang Hou Wei Ran was chancellor.
translations.idiomatic: In the twelfth year, Lou Huan was dismissed, and Lord Ranghou Wei Ran became chancellor.

sentences.zh: 予楚粟五萬石。

translations.literal: Gave Chu grain fifty thousand shi.
translations.idiomatic: They gave Chu fifty thousand shi of grain.

translations.literal: In King Zhao Xiang's first year, Yan Jun Ji became chancellor. Gan Mao went out to Wei. In the second year, a comet was seen. Shu Zhang Zhuang rebelled with grand ministers, feudal lords, and gong zi. They were all executed, and Queen Hui Wen also did not get a good death. Queen Dao Wu Wang went out and returned to Wei. In the third year, the king was crowned. He met with the Chu king at Huangji and ceded Shangyong to Chu. In the fourth year, they took Puban. A comet was seen. In the fifth year, the Wei king came to court at Yingting. They again gave Puban to Wei. In the sixth year, Shu hou Hui rebelled. Sima Cuo pacified Shu. Shu Zhang Huan attacked Chu and beheaded twenty thousand. Lord Jingyang was a hostage in Qi. There was a solar eclipse. The day was dark. In the seventh year, they pulled Xincheng. Mang Li Zi died. In the eighth year, they had General Mi Rong attack Chu and take Xinshi. Qi sent Zhang Zi, Wei sent Gong Sun Xi, Han sent Bao Yuan. They together attacked Chu's Fangcheng and took Tangmian. Zhao broke Zhongshan. Its ruler fled and finally died in Qi. Wei Gong Zi Jing and Han Gong Zi Chang became feudal lords. In the ninth year, Meng Chang Jun Xue Wen came to be chancellor of Qin. Huan attacked Chu, took eight cities, and killed their general Jing Kuai. In the tenth year, Chu's King Huai entered to court Qin. Qin detained him. Xue Wen was dismissed through bribery with gold. Lou Huan became chancellor. In the eleventh year, Qi, Han, Wei, Zhao, Song, and Zhongshan - five states together attacked Qin. They reached Yanshi and returned. Qin made peace with Han and Wei by giving them the land north of the Yellow River and Fengling. A comet was seen. Chu's King Huai fled to Zhao. Zhao did not accept him. They returned him to Qin, where he immediately died. His body was returned for burial. In the twelfth year, Lou Huan was dismissed. Rang Hou Wei Ran became chancellor. They gave Chu fifty thousand shi of grain.

sentences.zh: 十三年，向壽伐韓，取武始。

translations.literal: Thirteenth year, Xiang Shou attacked Han, took Wu Shi.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirteenth year, Xiang Shou attacked Han and took Wushi.

sentences.zh: 左更白起攻新城。

translations.literal: Left more Bai Qi attacked Xin Cheng.
translations.idiomatic: Left Minister Bai Qi attacked Xincheng.

sentences.zh: 五大夫禮出亡奔魏。

translations.literal: Five great men Li went out fled to Wei.
translations.idiomatic: The Five Great Officers Li went into exile and fled to Wei.

sentences.zh: 任鄙為漢中守。

translations.literal: Ren Bi was Han middle guard.
translations.idiomatic: Ren Bi became governor of Hanzhong.

sentences.zh: 十四年，左更白起攻韓、魏於伊闕，斬首二十四萬，虜公孫喜，拔五城。

translations.literal: Fourteenth year, left more Bai Qi attacked Han, Wei at Yi Que, beheaded two hundred forty thousand, captured Gong Sun Xi, pulled five cities.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourteenth year, Left Minister Bai Qi attacked Han and Wei at Yique, beheaded two hundred forty thousand, captured Gongsun Xi, and took five cities.

sentences.zh: 十五年，大良造白起攻魏，取垣，復予之。

translations.literal: Fifteenth year, great good maker Bai Qi attacked Wei, took Yuan, again gave it.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifteenth year, Grand Commandant Bai Qi attacked Wei, took Yuan, and then gave it back.

sentences.zh: 攻楚，取宛。

translations.literal: Attacked Chu, took Wan.
translations.idiomatic: He attacked Chu and took Wan.

sentences.zh: 十六年，左更錯取軹及鄧。

translations.literal: Sixteenth year, left more Cuo took Zhi and Deng.
translations.idiomatic: In the sixteenth year, Left Minister Cuo took Zhi and Deng.

sentences.zh: 冉免，封公子市宛，公子悝鄧，魏冉陶，為諸侯。

translations.literal: Ran dismissed, enfeoffed gong zi Shi Wan, gong zi Kui Deng, Wei Ran Tao, became feudal lords.
translations.idiomatic: Ran was dismissed. Prince Shi was enfeoffed at Wan, Prince Kui at Deng, and Wei Ran at Tao, becoming feudal lords.

sentences.zh: 十七年，城陽君入朝，及東周君來朝。

translations.literal: Seventeenth year, Cheng Yang Jun entered court, and Dong Zhou Jun came court.
translations.idiomatic: In the seventeenth year, Lord Chengyang entered to pay court, and Lord Dongzhou came to pay court.

sentences.zh: 秦以垣為蒲阪、皮氏。

translations.literal: Qin changed Yuan to Pu Ban, Pi Shi.
translations.idiomatic: Qin changed Yuan to Puban and Pishi.

sentences.zh: 王之宜陽。

translations.literal: King went to Yi Yang.
translations.idiomatic: The king went to Yiyang.

sentences.zh: 十八年，錯攻垣、河雍，決橋取之。

translations.literal: Eighteenth year, Cuo attacked Yuan, He Yong, broke bridge took it.
translations.idiomatic: In the eighteenth year, Cuo attacked Yuan and Heyong, broke the bridge, and took them.

sentences.zh: 十九年，王為西帝，齊為東帝，皆復去之。

translations.literal: Nineteenth year, king was west emperor, Qi was east emperor, all again abandoned it.
translations.idiomatic: In the nineteenth year, the king became Western Emperor and Qi became Eastern Emperor, but they both soon abandoned these titles.

sentences.zh: 呂禮來自歸。

translations.literal: Lu Li came from self surrender.
translations.idiomatic: Lu Li came and surrendered of his own accord.

sentences.zh: 齊破宋，宋王在魏，死溫。

translations.literal: Qi broke Song, Song king in Wei, died Wen.
translations.idiomatic: Qi destroyed Song. The King of Song was in Wei and died at Wen.

sentences.zh: 任鄙卒。

translations.literal: Ren Bi died.
translations.idiomatic: Ren Bi passed away.

sentences.zh: 二十年，王之漢中，又之上郡、北河。

translations.literal: Twentieth year, king went to Han middle, again to Shang commandery, north river.
translations.idiomatic: In the twentieth year, the king went to Hanzhong, and then again to Shang commandery and the northern river regions.

sentences.zh: 二十一年，錯攻魏河內。

translations.literal: Twenty-first year, Cuo attacked Wei river inner.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-first year, Cuo attacked Wei's Henan region.

sentences.zh: 魏獻安邑，秦出其人，募徙河東賜爵，赦罪人遷之。

translations.literal: Wei offered An Yi, Qin expelled its people, recruited moved river east granted nobility, pardoned criminals moved them.
translations.idiomatic: Wei offered Anyi. Qin expelled its people, recruited settlers to Hedong and granted them nobility ranks, and pardoned criminals to move them there.

sentences.zh: 涇陽君封宛。

translations.literal: Jing Yang Jun enfeoffed Wan.
translations.idiomatic: Lord Jingyang was enfeoffed at Wan.

sentences.zh: 二十二年，蒙武伐齊。

translations.literal: Twenty-second year, Meng Wu attacked Qi.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-second year, Meng Wu attacked Qi.

sentences.zh: 河東為九縣。

translations.literal: River east made nine counties.
translations.idiomatic: Hedong was divided into nine counties.

sentences.zh: 與楚王會宛。

translations.literal: With Chu king met Wan.
translations.idiomatic: He met with the King of Chu at Wan.

sentences.zh: 與趙王會中陽。

translations.literal: With Zhao king met Zhong Yang.
translations.idiomatic: He met with the King of Zhao at Zhongyang.

sentences.zh: 二十三年，尉斯離與三晉、燕伐齊，破之濟西。

translations.literal: Twenty-third year, Wei Si Li with three Jin, Yan attacked Qi, broke it Ji west.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-third year, Wei Si Li with the Three Jin states and Yan attacked Qi and defeated them west of the Ji River.

sentences.zh: 王與魏王會宜陽，與韓王會新城。

translations.literal: King with Wei king met Yi Yang, with Han king met Xin Cheng.
translations.idiomatic: The king met with the King of Wei at Yiyang, and with the King of Han at Xincheng.

sentences.zh: 二十四年，與楚王會鄢，又會穰。

translations.literal: Twenty-fourth year, with Chu king met Yan, again met Rang.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-fourth year, he met with the King of Chu at Yan, and again at Rang.

sentences.zh: 秦取魏安城，至大梁，燕、趙救之，秦軍去。

translations.literal: Qin took Wei An Cheng, reached Da Liang, Yan, Zhao rescued it, Qin army went.
translations.idiomatic: Qin took Wei's Ancheng and reached Daliang. Yan and Zhao came to rescue it, and the Qin army withdrew.

sentences.zh: 魏冉免相。

translations.literal: Wei Ran dismissed chancellor.
translations.idiomatic: Wei Ran was dismissed as chancellor.

sentences.zh: 二十五年，拔趙二城。

translations.literal: Twenty-fifth year, pulled Zhao two cities.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-fifth year, they captured two cities of Zhao.

sentences.zh: 與韓王會新城，與魏王會新明邑。

translations.literal: With Han king met Xin Cheng, with Wei king met Xin Ming Yi.
translations.idiomatic: He met with the King of Han at Xincheng, and with the King of Wei at Xinmingyi.

sentences.zh: 二十六年，赦罪人遷之穰。

translations.literal: Twenty-sixth year, pardoned criminals moved them to Rang.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-sixth year, they pardoned criminals and moved them to Rang.

sentences.zh: 侯冉復相。

translations.literal: Hou Ran again chancellor.
translations.idiomatic: Hou Ran again became chancellor.

sentences.zh: 二十七年，錯攻楚。

translations.literal: Twenty-seventh year, Cuo attacked Chu.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-seventh year, Cuo attacked Chu.

sentences.zh: 赦罪人遷之南陽。

translations.literal: Pardoned criminals moved them to Nan Yang.
translations.idiomatic: They pardoned criminals and moved them to Nanyang.

sentences.zh: 白起攻趙，取代光狼城。

translations.literal: Bai Qi attacked Zhao, took Dai Guang Lang city.
translations.idiomatic: Bai Qi attacked Zhao and took the city of Guanglang in Dai.

sentences.zh: 又使司馬錯發隴西，因蜀攻楚黔中，拔之。

translations.literal: Again made Si Ma Cuo sent Long Xi, following Shu attacked Chu Qian middle, pulled it.
translations.idiomatic: They again sent Sima Cuo to mobilize troops from Longxi, following the route through Shu to attack Chu's Qianzhong, and captured it.

sentences.zh: 二十八年，大良造白起攻楚，取鄢、鄧，赦罪人遷之。

translations.literal: Twenty-eighth year, great good maker Bai Qi attacked Chu, took Yan, Deng, pardoned criminals moved them.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-eighth year, Grand Commandant Bai Qi attacked Chu, took Yan and Deng, and moved pardoned criminals to live there.

sentences.zh: 二十九年，大良造白起攻楚，取郢為南郡，楚王走。

translations.literal: Twenty-ninth year, great good maker Bai Qi attacked Chu, took Ying as south commandery, Chu king fled.
translations.idiomatic: In the twenty-ninth year, Grand Commandant Bai Qi attacked Chu, took Ying and made it Nan commandery. The King of Chu fled.

sentences.zh: 周君來。

translations.literal: Zhou jun came.
translations.idiomatic: The Lord of Zhou came.

sentences.zh: 王與楚王會襄陵。

translations.literal: King with Chu king met Xiang Ling.
translations.idiomatic: The king met with the King of Chu at Xiangling.

sentences.zh: 白起為武安君。

translations.literal: Bai Qi was Wu An Jun.
translations.idiomatic: Bai Qi was titled Lord Wuan.

sentences.zh: 三十年，蜀守若伐楚，取巫郡，及江南為黔中郡。

translations.literal: Thirtieth year, Shu guard Ruo attacked Chu, took Wu commandery, and Jiangnan as Qian middle commandery.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirtieth year, Shu's governor Ruo attacked Chu, took Wu commandery, and made Jiangnan into Qianzhong commandery.

sentences.zh: 三十一年，白起伐魏，取兩城。

translations.literal: Thirty-first year, Bai Qi attacked Wei, took two cities.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-first year, Bai Qi attacked Wei and took two cities.

sentences.zh: 楚人反我江南。

translations.literal: Chu people rebelled our Jiangnan.
translations.idiomatic: The people of Chu rebelled in our Jiangnan region.

sentences.zh: 三十二年，相穰侯攻魏，至大梁，破暴鳶，斬首四萬，鳶走，魏入三縣請和。

translations.literal: Thirty-second year, chancellor Rang Hou attacked Wei, reached Da Liang, broke Bao Yuan, beheaded forty thousand, Yuan fled, Wei entered three counties pleaded peace.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-second year, Chancellor Lord Rang attacked Wei, reached Daliang, defeated Bao Yuan, beheaded forty thousand. Yuan fled, and Wei ceded three counties to sue for peace.

sentences.zh: 三十三年，客卿胡（傷）［陽］攻魏卷、蔡陽、長社，取之。

translations.literal: Thirty-third year, guest minister Hu Yang attacked Wei Juan, Cai Yang, Chang She, took them.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-third year, Guest Minister Hu Yang attacked Wei's Juan, Caiyang, and Changshe, and took them.

sentences.zh: 擊芒卯華陽，破之，斬首十五萬。

translations.literal: Struck Mang Mao Hua Yang, broke it, beheaded one hundred fifty thousand.
translations.idiomatic: He attacked Mangmao and Huayang, defeated them, and beheaded one hundred fifty thousand.

sentences.zh: 魏入南陽以和。

translations.literal: Wei entered Nan Yang to make peace.
translations.idiomatic: Wei ceded Nanyang to make peace.

sentences.zh: 三十四年，秦與魏、韓上庸地為一郡，南陽免臣遷居之。

translations.literal: Thirty-fourth year, Qin with Wei, Han Shang Yong land made one commandery, Nan Yang freed ministers moved lived there.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-fourth year, Qin combined the Shangyong lands of Wei and Han into one commandery. Freed ministers from Nanyang were moved to live there.

sentences.zh: 三十五年，佐韓、魏、楚伐燕。

translations.literal: Thirty-fifth year, assisted Han, Wei, Chu attacked Yan.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-fifth year, Qin assisted Han, Wei, and Chu in attacking Yan.

sentences.zh: 初置南陽郡。

translations.literal: Initially established Nan Yang commandery.
translations.idiomatic: Nanyang commandery was initially established.

sentences.zh: 三十六年，客卿灶攻齊，取剛、壽，予穰侯。

translations.literal: Thirty-sixth year, guest minister Zao attacked Qi, took Gang, Shou, gave to Rang Hou.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-sixth year, Guest Minister Zao attacked Qi, took Gang and Shou, and gave them to Lord Rang.

sentences.zh: 三十八年，中更胡（傷）［陽］攻趙閼與，不能取。

translations.literal: Thirty-eighth year, middle more Hu Yang attacked Zhao E Yu, could not take.
translations.idiomatic: In the thirty-eighth year, Central Minister Hu Yang attacked Zhao's Eyu but could not take it.

sentences.zh: 四十年，悼太子死魏，歸葬芷陽。

translations.literal: Fortieth year, Dao crown prince died Wei, returned buried Zhi Yang.
translations.idiomatic: In the fortieth year, Crown Prince Dao died in Wei and was returned for burial at Zhiyang.

sentences.zh: 四十一年夏，攻魏，取邢丘、懷。

translations.literal: Forty-first year summer, attacked Wei, took Xing Qiu, Huai.
translations.idiomatic: In the summer of the forty-first year, Qin attacked Wei and took Xingqiu and Huai.

sentences.zh: 四十二年，安國君為太子。

translations.literal: Forty-second year, An Guo Jun was crown prince.
translations.idiomatic: In the forty-second year, Lord Anguo became crown prince.

sentences.zh: 十月，宣太后薨，葬芷陽酈山。

translations.literal: Tenth month, Xuan Tai Hou died, buried Zhi Yang Li Shan.
translations.idiomatic: In the tenth month, Empress Dowager Xuan died and was buried at Zhiyang's Li Mountain.

sentences.zh: 九月，穰侯出之陶。

translations.literal: Ninth month, Rang Hou went out to Tao.
translations.idiomatic: In the ninth month, Lord Rang went out to Tao.

sentences.zh: 四十三年，武安君白起攻韓，拔九城，斬首五萬。

translations.literal: Forty-third year, Wu An Jun Bai Qi attacked Han, pulled nine cities, beheaded fifty thousand.
translations.idiomatic: In the forty-third year, Lord Wuan Bai Qi attacked Han, captured nine cities, and beheaded fifty thousand.

sentences.zh: 四十四年，攻韓南（郡）［陽］，取之。

translations.literal: Forty-fourth year, attacked Han Nan Yang, took it.
translations.idiomatic: In the forty-fourth year, Qin attacked Han's Nanyang and took it.

sentences.zh: 四十五年，五大夫賁攻韓，取十城。

translations.literal: Forty-fifth year, five great men Ben attacked Han, took ten cities.
translations.idiomatic: In the forty-fifth year, the Five Great Officers Ben attacked Han and took ten cities.

sentences.zh: 葉陽君悝出之國，未至而死。

translations.literal: Ye Yang Jun Kui went out to country, not yet arrived and died.
translations.idiomatic: Lord Yeyang Kui went out of the country but died before arriving.

sentences.zh: 四十七年，秦攻韓上黨，上黨降趙，秦因攻趙，趙發兵擊秦，相距。

translations.literal: Forty-seventh year, Qin attacked Han Shang Dang, Shang Dang surrendered Zhao, Qin therefore attacked Zhao, Zhao sent troops struck Qin, confronted.
translations.idiomatic: In the forty-seventh year, Qin attacked Han's Shangdang. Shangdang surrendered to Zhao, so Qin attacked Zhao. Zhao sent troops to strike Qin, and they confronted each other.

sentences.zh: 秦使武安君白起擊，大破趙於長平，四十餘萬盡殺之。

translations.literal: Qin made Wu An Jun Bai Qi strike, greatly broke Zhao at Chang Ping, forty more ten thousand all killed them.
translations.idiomatic: Qin sent Lord Wuan Bai Qi to strike. He greatly defeated Zhao at Changping and killed all forty-plus myriads of them.

sentences.zh: 四十八年十月，韓獻垣雍。

translations.literal: Forty-eighth year tenth month, Han offered Yuan Yong.
translations.idiomatic: In the tenth month of the forty-eighth year, Han offered Yuanyong.

sentences.zh: 秦軍分為三軍。

translations.literal: Qin army divided into three armies.
translations.idiomatic: The Qin army was divided into three armies.

sentences.zh: 武安君歸。

translations.literal: Wu An Jun returned.
translations.idiomatic: Lord Wuan returned.

sentences.zh: 王龁將伐趙（武安）皮牢，拔之。

translations.literal: Wang He will attack Zhao Pi Lao, pulled it.
translations.idiomatic: Wang He led the attack on Zhao's Pilao and captured it.

sentences.zh: 司馬梗北定太原，盡有韓上黨。

translations.literal: Si Ma Geng north pacified Tai Yuan, completely had Han Shang Dang.
translations.idiomatic: Sima Geng pacified Taiyuan to the north and completely controlled Han's Shangdang.

sentences.zh: 正月，兵罷，復守上黨。

translations.literal: First month, troops ceased, again guarded Shang Dang.
translations.idiomatic: In the first month, the troops were withdrawn and Shangdang was garrisoned again.

sentences.zh: 其十月，五大夫陵攻趙邯鄲。

translations.literal: Its tenth month, five great men Ling attacked Zhao Han Dan.
translations.idiomatic: In that tenth month, the Five Great Officers Ling attacked Zhao's Handan.

sentences.zh: 四十九年正月，益發卒佐陵。

translations.literal: Forty-ninth year first month, additionally sent troops assisted Ling.
translations.idiomatic: In the first month of the forty-ninth year, additional troops were sent to assist Ling.

sentences.zh: 陵戰不善，免，王龁代將。

translations.literal: Ling fought not well, dismissed, Wang He replaced as general.
translations.idiomatic: Ling fought poorly and was dismissed. Wang He replaced him as general.

sentences.zh: 其十月，將軍張唐攻魏，為蔡尉捐弗守，還斬之。

translations.literal: Its tenth month, general Zhang Tang attacked Wei, for Cai Wei Juan did not guard, returned beheaded him.
translations.idiomatic: In that tenth month, General Zhang Tang attacked Wei. Because Cai's Commandant Juan did not defend, he returned and beheaded him.

sentences.zh: 五十年十月，武安君白起有罪，為士伍，遷陰密。

translations.literal: Fiftieth year tenth month, Wu An Jun Bai Qi had crime, was common soldier, moved Yin Mi.
translations.idiomatic: In the tenth month of the fiftieth year, Lord Wuan Bai Qi was found guilty, demoted to common soldier, and moved to Yinmi.

sentences.zh: 張唐攻鄭，拔之。

translations.literal: Zhang Tang attacked Zheng, pulled it.
translations.idiomatic: Zhang Tang attacked Zheng and captured it.

sentences.zh: 十二月，益發卒軍汾城旁。

translations.literal: Twelfth month, additionally sent troops stationed beside Fen Cheng.
translations.idiomatic: In the twelfth month, additional troops were sent to station beside Fencheng.

sentences.zh: 武安君白起有罪，死。

translations.literal: Wu An Jun Bai Qi had crime, died.
translations.idiomatic: Lord Wuan Bai Qi was found guilty and died.

sentences.zh: 龁攻邯鄲，不拔，去，還奔汾軍。

translations.literal: He attacked Han Dan, not pulled, went, returned rushed to Fen army.
translations.idiomatic: He attacked Handan but could not capture it, so he withdrew and rushed back to the Fen army.

sentences.zh: 二月餘攻晉軍，斬首六千，晉楚流死河二萬人。

translations.literal: More than two months attacked Jin army, beheaded six thousand, Jin Chu drowned died river twenty thousand people.
translations.idiomatic: For more than two months they attacked the Jin army, beheaded six thousand, and twenty thousand of Jin and Chu drowned and died in the river.

sentences.zh: 攻汾城，即從唐拔寧新中，寧新中更名安陽。

translations.literal: Attacked Fen Cheng, then from Tang pulled Ning Xin middle, Ning Xin middle changed name An Yang.
translations.idiomatic: They attacked Fencheng, then captured Ningxinzhong from Tang. Ningxinzhong was renamed Anyang.

sentences.zh: 初作河橋。

translations.literal: Initially made river bridge.
translations.idiomatic: A bridge across the river was initially built.

translations.literal: In the thirteenth year, Xiang Shou attacked Han and took Wushi. Left More Bai Qi attacked Xincheng. The Five Great Men Li went out and fled to Wei. Ren Bi became the guard of Hanzhong. In the fourteenth year, Left More Bai Qi attacked Han and Wei at Yique, beheaded two hundred forty thousand, captured Gong Sun Xi, and pulled five cities. In the fifteenth year, Great Good Maker Bai Qi attacked Wei, took Yuan, and again gave it back. They attacked Chu and took Wan. In the sixteenth year, Left More Cuo took Zhi and Deng. Ran was dismissed. Gong Zi Shi was enfeoffed at Wan, Gong Zi Kui at Deng, and Wei Ran at Tao. They became feudal lords. In the seventeenth year, Lord Chengyang entered to court, and Lord Dongzhou came to court. Qin changed Yuan to Puban and Pishi. The king went to Yiyang. In the eighteenth year, Cuo attacked Yuan and Heyong, broke the bridge and took them. In the nineteenth year, the king became the Western Emperor and Qi became the Eastern Emperor. They all again abandoned these titles. Lu Li came and surrendered himself. Qi broke Song. The Song king was in Wei and died at Wen. Ren Bi died. In the twentieth year, the king went to Hanzhong, and again to Shang commandery and North River. In the twenty-first year, Cuo attacked Wei's Henei. Wei offered Anyi. Qin expelled its people, recruited migrants to Hedong and granted them nobility titles, and pardoned criminals to move them there. Lord Jingyang was enfeoffed at Wan. In the twenty-second year, Meng Wu attacked Qi. Hedong was made into nine counties. He met with the Chu king at Wan. He met with the Zhao king at Zhongyang. In the twenty-third year, Wei Si Li, together with the three Jin and Yan, attacked Qi and broke them west of the Ji. The king met with the Wei king at Yiyang and with the Han king at Xincheng. In the twenty-fourth year, he met with the Chu king at Yan and again at Rang. Qin took Wei's Ancheng and reached Daliang. Yan and Zhao rescued it, so the Qin army withdrew. Wei Ran was dismissed as chancellor. In the twenty-fifth year, they pulled two cities from Zhao. He met with the Han king at Xincheng and with the Wei king at Xinmingyi. In the twenty-sixth year, criminals were pardoned and moved to Rang. Hou Ran again became chancellor. In the twenty-seventh year, Cuo attacked Chu. Criminals were pardoned and moved to Nanyang. Bai Qi attacked Zhao and took Daiguanglang city. They again had Sima Cuo send troops from Longxi, following through Shu to attack Chu's Qianzhong, and pulled it. In the twenty-eighth year, Great Good Maker Bai Qi attacked Chu, took Yan and Deng, and pardoned criminals to move them there. In the twenty-ninth year, Great Good Maker Bai Qi attacked Chu, took Ying and made it Nanguo commandery. The Chu king fled. The Zhou jun came. The king met with the Chu king at Xiangling. Bai Qi became Lord Wuan. In the thirtieth year, Shu's guard Ruo attacked Chu, took Wujun, and Jiangnan as Qianzhong commandery. In the thirty-first year, Bai Qi attacked Wei and took two cities. The Chu people rebelled against our Jiangnan. In the thirty-second year, Chancellor Rang Hou attacked Wei and reached Daliang. He broke Bao Yuan, beheaded forty thousand. Yuan fled. Wei ceded three counties and pleaded for peace. In the thirty-third year, guest minister Hu Yang attacked Wei's Juan, Caiyang, and Changshe, and took them. They struck Mang Mao at Huayang, broke it, and beheaded one hundred fifty thousand. Wei ceded Nanyang to make peace. In the thirty-fourth year, Qin combined Shangyong land with Wei and Han into one commandery. Freed ministers from Nanyang were moved to live there. In the thirty-fifth year, they assisted Han, Wei, and Chu in attacking Yan. They initially established Nanyang commandery. In the thirty-sixth year, guest minister Zao attacked Qi, took Gang and Shou, and gave them to Rang Hou. In the thirty-eighth year, Middle More Hu Yang attacked Zhao's Eyu but could not take it. In the fortieth year, Crown Prince Dao died in Wei. He was returned and buried at Zhiyang. In summer of the forty-first year, they attacked Wei and took Xingqiu and Huai. In the forty-second year, Lord Anguo became crown prince. In the tenth month, Xuan Taihou died. She was buried at Lishan in Zhiyang. In the ninth month, Rang Hou went out to Tao. In the forty-third year, Lord Wuan Bai Qi attacked Han, pulled nine cities, and beheaded fifty thousand. In the forty-fourth year, they attacked Han's Nanyang and took it. In the forty-fifth year, the Five Great Men Ben attacked Han and took ten cities. Lord Yeyang Kui went out to the country. He died before arriving. In the forty-seventh year, Qin attacked Han's Shangdang. Shangdang surrendered to Zhao. Qin therefore attacked Zhao. Zhao sent troops to strike Qin. They confronted each other. Qin had Lord Wuan Bai Qi strike. He greatly broke Zhao at Changping and killed all four hundred thousand. In the tenth month of the forty-eighth year, Han offered Yuanyong. The Qin army was divided into three armies. Lord Wuan returned. Wang He was to attack Zhao's Pilao and pull it. Sima Geng pacified Taiyuan to the north and completely took Han's Shangdang. In the first month, troops were dismissed. They again guarded Shangdang. In that tenth month, the Five Great Men Ling attacked Zhao's Handan. In the first month of the forty-ninth year, they additionally sent troops to assist Ling. Ling fought poorly and was dismissed. Wang He replaced him as general. In that tenth month, General Zhang Tang attacked Wei. Because Cai Wei Juan did not guard, he returned and beheaded him. In the tenth month of the fiftieth year, Lord Wuan Bai Qi had a crime. He was made a common soldier and moved to Yinmi. Zhang Tang attacked Zheng and pulled it. In the twelfth month, they additionally sent troops to station beside Fencheng. Lord Wuan Bai Qi had a crime and died. He attacked Handan but could not pull it. He went and returned to rush to the Fen army. For more than two months they attacked the Jin army, beheaded six thousand, and twenty thousand Jin and Chu people drowned and died in the river. They attacked Fencheng, then from Tang pulled Ningxinzhong. Ningxinzhong changed its name to Anyang. They initially made a river bridge.

sentences.zh: 五十一年，將軍摎攻韓，取陽城、負黍，斬首四萬。

translations.literal: Fifty-first year, general Liu attacked Han, took Yang Cheng, Fu Shu, beheaded forty thousand.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifty-first year, General Liu attacked Han, took Yangcheng and Fushu, and beheaded forty thousand.

sentences.zh: 攻趙，取二十餘縣，首虜九萬。

translations.literal: Attacked Zhao, took more than twenty counties, heads captured ninety thousand.
translations.idiomatic: They attacked Zhao, took more than twenty counties, and captured ninety thousand heads.

sentences.zh: 西周君背秦，與諸侯約從，將天下銳兵出伊闕攻秦，令秦毋得通陽城。

translations.literal: West Zhou jun betrayed Qin, with feudal lords allied, led world sharp troops out Yi Que attacked Qin, made Qin not able to connect Yang Cheng.
translations.idiomatic: The Lord of Western Zhou betrayed Qin, allied with the feudal lords, led the world's best troops out of Yique to attack Qin, and prevented Qin from connecting with Yangcheng.

sentences.zh: 於是秦使將軍摎攻西周。

translations.literal: Thereupon Qin made general Liu attack West Zhou.
translations.idiomatic: Thereupon Qin sent General Liu to attack Western Zhou.

sentences.zh: 西周君走來自歸，頓首受罪，盡獻其邑三十六城，口三萬。

translations.literal: West Zhou jun fled came self surrendered, knocked head received punishment, completely offered his yi thirty-six cities, mouths thirty thousand.
translations.idiomatic: The Lord of Western Zhou fled and came to surrender of his own accord. He kowtowed and accepted punishment, completely offering his thirty-six cities and thirty thousand people.

sentences.zh: 秦王受獻，歸其君於周。

translations.literal: Qin king accepted offering, returned his jun to Zhou.
translations.idiomatic: The King of Qin accepted the offering and returned the lord to Zhou.

sentences.zh: 五十二年，周民東亡，其器九鼎入秦。

translations.literal: Fifty-second year, Zhou people east fled, their vessels nine ding entered Qin.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifty-second year, the Zhou people fled east, and their nine ding vessels entered Qin.

sentences.zh: 周初亡。

translations.literal: Zhou initially perished.
translations.idiomatic: Zhou began to perish.

translations.literal: In the fifty-first year, General Liu attacked Han, took Yangcheng and Fushu, and beheaded forty thousand. They attacked Zhao, took more than twenty counties, and captured ninety thousand heads. The West Zhou jun betrayed Qin and allied with the feudal lords. He led the world's sharp troops out of Yique to attack Qin, making Qin unable to connect to Yangcheng. Thereupon Qin had General Liu attack West Zhou. The West Zhou jun fled and came to surrender himself. He knocked his head and received punishment, completely offering his thirty-six cities and thirty thousand people. The Qin king accepted the offering and returned his jun to Zhou. In the fifty-second year, the Zhou people fled east. Their vessels, the nine ding, entered Qin. Zhou initially perished.

sentences.zh: 五十三年，天下來賓。

translations.literal: Fifty-third year, world came as guests.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifty-third year, the world came as guests.

sentences.zh: 魏後，秦使摎伐魏，取吳城。

translations.literal: Wei later, Qin made Liu attacked Wei, took Wu Cheng.
translations.idiomatic: Later, Wei followed. Qin sent Liu to attack Wei and take Wucheng.

sentences.zh: 韓王入朝，魏委國聽令。

translations.literal: Han king entered court, Wei entrusted state listened to commands.
translations.idiomatic: The King of Han entered to pay court, and Wei entrusted its state and obeyed commands.

sentences.zh: 五十四年，王郊見上帝於雍。

translations.literal: Fifty-fourth year, king suburb saw Shang Di at Yong.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifty-fourth year, the king performed the suburban sacrifice and saw the Supreme Deity at Yong.

sentences.zh: 五十六年秋，昭襄王卒，子孝文王立。

translations.literal: Fifty-sixth year autumn, Zhao Xiang Wang died, son Xiao Wen Wang established.
translations.idiomatic: In the autumn of the fifty-sixth year, King Zhaoxiang died, and his son King Xiaowen took the throne.

sentences.zh: 尊唐八子為唐太后，而合其葬於先王。

translations.literal: Honored Tang Ba Zi as Tang Tai Hou, and combined her burial with previous kings.
translations.idiomatic: They honored Tang Bazi as Empress Dowager Tang and combined her burial with the previous kings.

sentences.zh: 韓王衰绖入弔祠，諸侯皆使其將相來弔祠，視喪事。

translations.literal: Han king mourning clothes entered condolence sacrifice, feudal lords all made their generals chancellors come condolence sacrifice, viewed funeral affairs.
translations.idiomatic: The King of Han entered in mourning clothes to offer condolences and sacrifices. All the feudal lords sent their generals and chancellors to offer condolences and sacrifices, and to view the funeral affairs.

translations.literal: In the fifty-third year, the world came as guests. Later, Wei. Qin had Liu attack Wei and take Wucheng. The Han king entered to court. Wei entrusted its state and listened to commands. In the fifty-fourth year, the king in the suburbs saw Shangdi at Yong. In autumn of the fifty-sixth year, King Zhao Xiang died. His son King Xiao Wen was established. They honored Tang Ba Zi as Tang Taihou and combined her burial with the previous kings. The Han king in mourning clothes entered to offer condolences and sacrifices. All the feudal lords had their generals and chancellors come to offer condolences and sacrifices and view the funeral affairs.

sentences.zh: 孝文王元年，赦罪人，修先王功臣，褒厚親戚，弛苑囿。

translations.literal: Xiao Wen Wang first year, pardoned criminals, repaired previous king merit ministers, praised thickened relatives, relaxed gardens enclosures.
translations.idiomatic: In the first year of King Xiaowen, he pardoned criminals, honored the meritorious ministers of previous kings, praised and enriched his relatives, and relaxed restrictions on gardens and enclosures.

sentences.zh: 孝文王除喪，十月己亥即位，三日辛醜卒，子莊襄王立。

translations.literal: Xiao Wen Wang removed mourning, tenth month Ji Hai ascended throne, three days Xin Chou died, son Zhuang Xiang Wang established.
translations.idiomatic: King Xiaowen ended mourning. In the tenth month, on Jihai day, he ascended the throne. Three days later, on Xinchou day, he died, and his son King Zhuangxiang took the throne.

translations.literal: In King Xiao Wen's first year, they pardoned criminals, repaired the previous king's merit ministers, praised and thickened relatives, and relaxed the gardens and enclosures. King Xiao Wen removed mourning. In the tenth month on Jihai day he ascended the throne. Three days later on Xinchou day he died. His son King Zhuang Xiang was established.

sentences.zh: 莊襄王元年，大赦罪人，修先王功臣，施德厚骨肉而布惠於民。

translations.literal: Zhuang Xiang Wang first year, great pardon criminals, repaired previous king merit ministers, applied virtue thickened bone flesh and spread favor to people.
translations.idiomatic: In the first year of King Zhuangxiang, he granted a great pardon to criminals, honored the meritorious ministers of previous kings, applied virtue to enrich his flesh and blood, and spread favor to the people.

sentences.zh: 東周君與諸侯謀秦，秦使相國呂不韋誅之，盡入其國。

translations.literal: East Zhou jun with feudal lords plotted Qin, Qin made chancellor Lu Bu Wei execute him, completely entered his state.
translations.idiomatic: The Lord of Eastern Zhou conspired with the feudal lords against Qin. Qin had Chancellor Lü Buwei execute him and completely took his state.

sentences.zh: 秦不絕其祀，以陽人地賜周君，奉其祭祀。

translations.literal: Qin not cut off its sacrifices, with Yang Ren land granted Zhou jun, carried its sacrificial offerings.
translations.idiomatic: Qin did not cut off its sacrifices, granting the Lord of Zhou land at Yangren to carry out its sacrificial offerings.

sentences.zh: 使蒙驁伐韓，韓獻成皋、鞏。

translations.literal: Made Meng Ao attack Han, Han offered Cheng Gao, Gong.
translations.idiomatic: He sent Meng Ao to attack Han, and Han offered Chenggao and Gong.

sentences.zh: 秦界至大梁，初置三川郡。

translations.literal: Qin border reached Da Liang, initially established San Chuan commandery.
translations.idiomatic: Qin's border reached Daliang, and Sanchuan commandery was initially established.

sentences.zh: 二年，使蒙驁攻趙，定太原。

translations.literal: Second year, made Meng Ao attack Zhao, pacified Tai Yuan.
translations.idiomatic: In the second year, he sent Meng Ao to attack Zhao and pacify Taiyuan.

sentences.zh: 三年，蒙驁攻魏高都、汲，拔之。

translations.literal: Third year, Meng Ao attacked Wei Gao Du, Ji, pulled them.
translations.idiomatic: In the third year, Meng Ao attacked Wei's Gaodu and Ji, and captured them.

sentences.zh: 攻趙榆次、新城、狼孟，取三十七城。

translations.literal: Attacked Zhao Yu Ci, Xin Cheng, Lang Meng, took thirty-seven cities.
translations.idiomatic: He attacked Zhao's Yuci, Xincheng, and Langmeng, taking thirty-seven cities.

sentences.zh: 四月日食。

translations.literal: Fourth month solar eclipse.
translations.idiomatic: In the fourth month, there was a solar eclipse.

sentences.zh: （四年）王龁攻上黨。

translations.literal: (Fourth year) Wang He attacked Shang Dang.
translations.idiomatic: (In the fourth year) Wang He attacked Shangdang.

sentences.zh: 初置太原郡。

translations.literal: Initially established Tai Yuan commandery.
translations.idiomatic: Taiyuan commandery was initially established.

sentences.zh: 魏將無忌率五國兵擊秦，秦卻於河外。

translations.literal: Wei general Wu Ji led five states troops struck Qin, Qin retreated at river outside.
translations.idiomatic: Wei general Wu Ji led troops from five states to attack Qin, and Qin retreated beyond the river.

sentences.zh: 蒙驁敗，解而去。

translations.literal: Meng Ao defeated, disbanded and went.
translations.idiomatic: Meng Ao was defeated, disbanded his troops, and left.

sentences.zh: 五月丙午，莊襄王卒，子政立，是為秦始皇帝。

translations.literal: Fifth month Bing Wu, Zhuang Xiang Wang died, son Zheng established, this was Qin Shi Huang Di.
translations.idiomatic: In the fifth month, on Bingwu day, King Zhuangxiang died. His son Zheng took the throne—this was Qin Shihuangdi.

translations.literal: In King Zhuang Xiang's first year, they greatly pardoned criminals, repaired the previous king's merit ministers, applied virtue to thicken bone and flesh, and spread favor to the people. The East Zhou jun plotted with the feudal lords against Qin. Qin had Chancellor Lu Buwei execute him and completely entered his state. Qin did not cut off its sacrifices. They granted Yangren land to the Zhou jun to carry out its sacrificial offerings. They had Meng Ao attack Han. Han offered Chenggao and Gong. Qin's border reached Daliang. They initially established Sanchuan commandery. In the second year, they had Meng Ao attack Zhao and pacify Taiyuan. In the third year, Meng Ao attacked Wei's Gaodu and Ji and pulled them. They attacked Zhao's Yuci, Xincheng, and Langmeng, and took thirty-seven cities. In the fourth month there was a solar eclipse. (In the fourth year) Wang He attacked Shangdang. They initially established Taiyuan commandery. Wei general Wu Ji led five states' troops to strike Qin. Qin retreated outside the river. Meng Ao was defeated and disbanded and went. In the fifth month on Bingwu day, King Zhuang Xiang died. His son Zheng was established. He was Qin Shi Huangdi.

sentences.zh: 秦王政立二十六年，初并天下為三十六郡，號為始皇帝。

translations.literal: Qin king Zheng established twenty-six years, initially united world as thirty-six commanderies, titled Shi Huang Di.
translations.idiomatic: King Zheng of Qin took the throne for twenty-six years. He initially united the world into thirty-six commanderies and was titled Shihuangdi.

sentences.zh: 始皇帝五十一年而崩，子胡亥立，是為二世皇帝。

translations.literal: Shi Huang Di fifty-one years then collapsed, son Hu Hai established, this was Er Shi Huang Di.
translations.idiomatic: Shihuangdi ruled for fifty-one years and then died. His son Huhai took the throne—this was Ershi Huangdi.

sentences.zh: 三年，諸侯并起叛秦，趙高殺二世，立子嬰。

translations.literal: Third year, feudal lords together rose rebelled Qin, Zhao Gao killed Er Shi, established Zi Ying.
translations.idiomatic: In the third year, the feudal lords all rose in rebellion against Qin. Zhao Gao killed Ershi and established Ziying.

sentences.zh: 子嬰立月餘，諸侯誅之，遂滅秦。

translations.literal: Zi Ying established more than month, feudal lords executed him, then extinguished Qin.
translations.idiomatic: Ziying ruled for more than a month. The feudal lords executed him and thus extinguished Qin.

sentences.zh: 其語在始皇本紀中。

translations.literal: Its words are in Shi Huang ben ji middle.
translations.idiomatic: The account is in the Basic Annals of Shihuangdi.

translations.literal: Qin King Zheng was established for twenty-six years. He initially united the world into thirty-six commanderies and was titled Shi Huangdi. Shi Huangdi collapsed after fifty-one years. His son Hu Hai was established. He was Er Shi Huangdi. In the third year, the feudal lords together rose and rebelled against Qin. Zhao Gao killed Er Shi and established Zi Ying. Zi Ying was established for more than a month. The feudal lords executed him and then extinguished Qin. Its words are in the Shi Huang Annals.

sentences.zh: 太史公曰：秦之先為嬴姓。

translations.literal: Tai Shi Gong said: Qin's ancestor was Ying surname.
translations.idiomatic: The Grand Historian says: Qin's ancestor was of the Ying surname.

sentences.zh: 其後分封，以國為姓，有徐氏、郯氏、莒氏、終黎氏、運奄氏、菟裘氏、將梁氏、黃氏、江氏、修魚氏、白冥氏、蜚廉氏、秦氏。

translations.literal: His descendants enfeoffed, used states as surnames, had Xu clan, Tan clan, Ju clan, Zhong Li clan, Yun Yan clan, Tu Qiu clan, Jiang Liang clan, Huang clan, Jiang clan, Xiu Yu clan, Bai Ming clan, Fei Lian clan, Qin clan.
translations.idiomatic: His descendants were enfeoffed and took states as surnames: the Xu clan, Tan clan, Ju clan, Zhongli clan, Yunyan clan, Tuqiu clan, Jiangliang clan, Huang clan, Jiang clan, Xiuyu clan, Baiming clan, Feilian clan, and Qin clan.

sentences.zh: 然秦以其先造父封趙城，為趙氏。

translations.literal: However Qin with its ancestor Zao Fu enfeoffed Zhao city, was Zhao clan.
translations.idiomatic: However, Qin, with its ancestor Zaofu, was enfeoffed at Zhao city and became the Zhao clan.

translations.literal: The Grand Historian says: 'Qin's ancestor was of the Ying surname.' His descendants were enfeoffed and took their states as surnames. There were the Xu clan, Tan clan, Ju clan, Zhongli clan, Yunyan clan, Tuqiu clan, Jiangliang clan, Huang clan, Jiang clan, Xiuyu clan, Baiming clan, Feilian clan, and Qin clan. However, Qin took its ancestor Zaofu who was enfeoffed at Zhao city as the Zhao clan.
